Reviews.Title: “Great City Break Hotel for our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: PaulCav
Reviews.Content: We completely agree with all the previous positive reviews about hotel, location and helpful staff. We took a standard suite and everything was great about the room including bed, shower and facilities. There's a DVD player in the room and reception has a selection of the latest films if you want a quite night in after exploring Istanbul. The wifi in the room can be hit and miss but there's also an ethernet cable provided for a more stable internet connection and very useful for access to the internet and free access to computer in business lounge in reception. Breakfast was great with a wide selection of cereals, fruit, eggs made to order and other cooked items. Also great as they served up to 11am if you fancied a lie in! We ate in the hotel bistro and the rooftop restaurant and both decent enough and also ate at the Faros Hotel around the corner which was very good. If you want a very special meal go to the Mikla rooftop restaurant in the Marmara Hotel on the north side of the river. It's about 10 lira (Â£3) each way in a cab for about 10 minutes or probably 45 mins by public transport. It has a rooftop veranda which gives an amazing view of the river, the sea and the old city. Lots of people just go for a quick drink and the view but the food was fantastic (about 200 lira for two people, two courses and a bottle of wine - about Â£70 including service). The historic sites including Palace, Cistern, Hagia Sofya were amazing. The front of the Sultania hotel is next to a noisy bar (open until 1am) but nothing that earplugs didn't solve - let's face it if you stay in a hotel in a busy part of the old city you have to expect this. Otherwise stay on the 18th floor of a hotel outside the city for absolute peace. All the rooms have double glazing which helps and also look for the tiny air vents which when closed reduce noise even further. Do not miss out on using the Spa and swimming which are located in basement of Sultania. Free access to decent pool (we went in April and sometimes didn't see anyone else). We did consider going for an historic turkish bath but ultimately you end up travelling back to hotel through stressful city and ruining the effect. The Sultania steam room and turkish bath room were brilliant and the staff were great and we had a seperate massage too (all for 65 euros each for turkish bath and massage - 2.5 hours of bliss!) On a final note the staff were amazing and proved their help on our final day at the hotel when we discovered our flight home had been cancelled. It was a Friday morning and most hotels were fully booked but the Sultania is part of the Yasmak Hotel chain and owns 4 hotels on the same street. The Sultania was fully booked but within an hour we were booked into Yasmak Comfort (a literal 2 minute walk away) and our luggage transfered. This made an extra day in Istanbul a stress free one and we flew the next day. Always check your flight status before leaving your hotel! All in all a brilliant stay and recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to see the sights”
Reviews.Author: SurreyLadyP
Reviews.Content: In a perfect location and with really first class staff, the Sultania was a pleasure to visit. Excellent welcome and the concierge could not have been more helpful and went out of his way to keep us informed of events happening in the city each day. Great breakfast buffet, likewise the coffee! When showers were forecast, a tub of umbrellas immediately appeared - every detail was thoughtful. Only criticism - no body lotion in the bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Restful Oasis in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: DCLregular
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights during our tour of Turkey. The service at this hotel is outstanding. From the moment you walk in you are made to feel welcome and acknowledged as a treasured guest. The breakfast offers a large variety of options with excellent service. When we arrived for check in our reserved room was not ready so the hotel upgraded us to a large suite - a nice touch rather than making us wait. We had dinner one night in the roof top restaurant. The food was good and it was a peaceful reprieve from the touristy food at the nearby restaurants. The location was within walking distance of many tourist sights. If I go back to Istanbul I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: JaneBoleyn
Reviews.Content: Central location, sleek decor, clean and modern individually styled rooms, friendly, helpful staff. Delicious breakfast buffet with endless choice including fresh honeycomb and a vast array of breads - ask for freshly squeezed orange juice, it isn't on show. Free tea and coffee with pastries available all afternoon as well as Turkish sweetmeats in your room daily. Fresh and dried fruits in the hotel lobby. Really comfortable beds, excellent shower room with efficient plentiful hot water, beautifully decorated. Being only a few minutes walk from the Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque, the hotel is down one of the many tiny narrow streets and being driven there by the hotel taxi is an experience in itself! There is no view from the rooms, but that didn't matter at all. You are so near to the main sites and the waterside, you can walk everywhere or get the tram from the stop only 2 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Peter H
Reviews.Content: Spent a few days at the Sultania and found it an ideal location for exploring the historic Sultanahamet district of Istanbul. The service at the Sultania was exceptional, the staff couldn't be friendlier or more helpful. Breakfast was a delight, and set us up for busy days exploring the historic sights of Istanbul, most of which are within an easy walk of the hotel. The beautifully kept pool and spa in the basement were a bonus. The street outside is lined with excellent resturants, though they can be a bit pushy trying to get you to eat at their particular place. Watch the restaurants under the Galata bridge, we were conned into ordering way too much food, and ended up with a hefty bill and a lot of leftovers. However I would recommend an Istanbul holiday to anyone, and the Sultania is definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “5* location and staff - iffy bathrooms!”
Reviews.Author: FlorenceNewt
Reviews.Content: Booked the Sultania based on Tripadvisor recommendations - and agree with (almost) everything that other visitors have said. Food, personnel and location are fabulous. My only complaint was with the room - and in particular the bathrooms which appear as a triumph of conceptual design over practicality. There is very little privacy in what is, ostensibly, an illuminated glass box in a corner of the room. Thin glass, transfer printed with a 19th century Italian Orientialist painting, affords very little in the way of soundproofing (the door didn't close properly, either!) While lying in my bed, the toilet was three feet (1 meter) from me - not a great view for a 4-star hotel! The glass walls of the enclosure meant that the entire room was flooded with light (not convenient in the middle of the night!) There was nowhere to put anything within the bathroom. Our room had no natural lighting save for a tiny vertical window overlooking the air-conditioning units. The rest of the lighting was either orange in hue, or useless. No task lighting for reading, writing, applying makeup etc. Blue standby lights illuminated the many light switches - far too many of these; tinny overhead speakers for the flat screen tv. Wish I'd have known about the pillow menu - I'd have traded in my rock hard lumpy one for something more comfortable. So - the staff and restaurant (the Olive is particularly good) made up for these negatives. I'd come back to the Sultania, but I'd also try its sister hotels that (according to the receptionist) have 'proper' bathrooms for those of us that appreciate personal space with walls and a door that is separate from the sleeping accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: StanimirSofia
Reviews.Content: I was in Sultania hotel for the second time with my family. Great experience. An excellent butique hotel in the very heart of Old town. On a walking distance from many interesting places - Agia Sofia, Sultanahmed mosque, Grand Bazaaar. On a quiet street, just a block away from tramway line, Station, and pier. As I come from Bulgaria I was with my car, and it was parked by the corner - safe and secure. The breakfast was rich and full. And most important - staff is perfect - friendly, competent and supportive. Thank you. I would stay at your hotel each time when I visit my favourite Istanbul. I would recommend it to all of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Aurelio52
Reviews.Content: Having finished a cruise on the Mediterranean the hotel needed to fill very big shoes. They did with flying colours. The room, the location, the staff, it was all excellent. Not sure when we will be back in Intanbul but whenever that is we will certainly stay at Sultania.

Reviews.Title: “Lush!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kaytie66
Reviews.Content: A fabulous hotel - the staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are exquisite. The breakfast is amazing - the best I have experienced. Excellent location with magnificent views from the roof top terrace. The food in the restaurant is the best we ate while in Istanbul; Turkish cuisine with a western twist, amazing serve with a very helpful sommelier. It would be hard to beat this small, quiet but friendly hotel. I would unreservably reccommend this to any one visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “very good tourist hotel with wonderful breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: trevor t
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 4 nights at the Sultania. It's location is perfect if you are a tourist, being in the heart of the old city. It is located on a pedestrian only road, so it is very much quieter than might be expected - we could sleep with the windows open with very little disturbance. The rooms were clean, not very large, but comfortable for two people, and we had a small balcony. The breakfast was wonderful and was the best buffet I have seen for ages. The staff are all very helpful, with most of them speaking very good English. I would not hesitate to recommend it to others, or to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sleep with the Sultana”
Reviews.Author: SusanLW55
Reviews.Content: The welcome and check in was excellent- offered a seat and a drink whilst our bags were taken to our room. We were right in the centre of things, easy walking distance to the main sights or to the tram. Excellent location surrounded by good restaurants. Rooms are themed around various Sultans or Sultanas and furnished in a beautiful contemporary style with an Eastern twist. All the staff are friendly and helpful. Good breakfast buffet and excellent service. We shall definitely seek this hotel out again when visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Fay G
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Istambul and the staff provided very helpful information which enhanced our stay in this magic city

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a Sultan!”
Reviews.Author: DavidNeil_11
Reviews.Content: They said we'd feel like a Sultan (or Sultans), and we did. This is a gem of a hotel right in the centre of things in the Sultanahmet district. Walking district of all the main sights, and with a great position on the tram route. Rooms are beautifully furnished, well equipped and have especially comfortable beds. The breakfast buffet was excellent, with a superb array of home-baked breads and pastries. Joining it all together were the wonderful staff; amongst the most friendly, helpful and efficient of any I've ever encountered. Altogether a most enjoyable experience. Thank you Sultania!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in Sultanhamet”
Reviews.Author: Marc D
Reviews.Content: Very good, charming hotel on an ideal location. Very nice rooms, very friendly staff. Close to Aya Sophia, Topkapi, Blue Mosk, Spice Bazaar, .... Numerous small restaurants in the close neighbourhood. I can recommend Sultania to everyone planning a city trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The other recommendations were accurate: It's a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Whats4dessert
Reviews.Content: From the welcome to the send off, we were consistently met with professional and warm service. The rooms are small but are very clean and well-maintained. Small touches such as small trays of Turkish delight treats each night, the breakfast buffet was superb, and the guest services were gracious and helpful. We found their free wi fi internet to be spotty, but since we were on vacation, it was not critical for us, but it might be a problem if one really relied on the net. Servers at breakfast were top-notch and on our last day a man who we had seen cleaning our room saw us waiting for our car, came over to us and with the warmest and most sincere smile, thanked us. Sultania is located 5-10 minutes from the most popular sites and is about two minutes from the nearest tram stop so it's very convenient. If I return to Istanbul, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small friendly hotel in old part of city”
Reviews.Author: James D
Reviews.Content: Very friendly welcome to a luxurious room with good shower, kettle, minibar, lots of lights all in good order and working. Fantastic range of food for breakfast. Very friendly and helpful staff. Fast free internet. Good sauna, turkish bath, pool and gym. Excellent location for the main sites within 10min walk, good restaurants close by and a wide range of shops and tram stop 3 mins away. Sweets, dried and fresh fruit in lobby and often pastries from breakfast. A hotel that is interested in first its guests and their needs and comfort before making every last penny from one.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service in great location”
Reviews.Author: AOA68
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sultania Hotel for 4 nights in the last week in March and I couldn't have hoped for a better experience. The first and most brilliant aspect of the stay was that as soon as the reception realised that I had arrived alone and without my wife, I was told that I would only be charged for single occupancy, despite booking a double room with terrace (5th floor) and not even raising the issue. I must say that I remained suspicious until I was given the check-out bill. I was really stunned that a hotel would take such an initiative. The hotel is unique in terms of the service, which was unfailingly top class across all aspects (over years of frequent visits to Istanbul, I doubt I have come across a better Breakfast buffet), the location which was close to transport hubs (Gulhane Metro is a few steps away) as well as main historical sites (Blue Mosque, Haige Sofia, Museum of Science and Tech in Islam, Topkapi Palace, Bosphorus, etc). If there was a drawback, then it was the poor and intermittent Wi Fi connection in my room. Otherwise, top marks and huge thank you to everyone at the Sultania for making this visit one of the best ever to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Cintia Z
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel....it was one of the highlights of my stay in Istanbul. The staff was very friendly and very helpful, the location is prime, the room is beautiful and the breakfast is memorable. Additionally, it is small and with a lot of character.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with all the good things said elsewhere and we are fussy.”
Reviews.Author: Essexboy10
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in old town but have the address, with phone number and google map of hotel with you as taxis cannot get right outside and do not always know the side road. The taxi from the airport ( very easy and only circa TL50) had to phone. Hotel bus did not wait long enough as it took an hour to get through immigration etc. Staff are superb. Ask about using the tram at bottom of road and other trains as so much better then getting stuck in the traffic. Hotel was excellent in all respects. Breakfasts were very good and restaurant also good but do check out restaurant opposite to hotel entrance as best we found in Istanbul including the fish restaurants in Kumkapi and also down Nevizade Street (must see in the evenings). ATM Nothing to do with the hotel but be careful when using the ATMs in Istanbul especially near rail station. A stranger will help with the language, play a trick with your card and the stupid machines shown your pin numbers in large print on the screen for all to see - we got stung and are very cautious.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Service, Very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dimitris M
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in Sultania and the experience was fantastic. It certainly made our trip! The location is great. Although it is very close ( 2 minutes walk) to the main sightseeing area of the old town (AgyaSofia, Top Kapi), the hotel is located in a small and quiet street, so it doesn't get busy and loud. Also it is very convenient as it is next to a tram stop. So moving to other areas of the City is very easy. Having spent sometime in Taksim square (the other area of Istanbul full of hotels) I definitely prefer the old town location-wise. The rooms are very cozy and very clean. The decoration successfully sets a Turkish / Ottoman scene and it is not too much. The hotel amenities include everything you would expect from a luxury boutique hotel (bathrobes, toiletries, wi-fi, etc) and there is not one thing I can think of that was not available. Last but not least, the hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I contacted Hilmi at guest relations in advance, in order to book some restaurants. He was very helpful, his replies were fast and his suggestions were spot on. Having been to many hotels, I would easily rate top 5 the service of hotel Sultania.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, Luxurious rooms, and Super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ahmad A
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely located in old city of Istanbul. Further it is elegantly furnished with a touch of exotic Ottoman style. The staff are doing more than what you expect to keep your trip uneventful and to make you comfortable. The price is reasonable for the comfort and atmosphere. I stayed twice at this hotel and definitely I will keep top on my choice list on my next visit to Istanbul. In addition I will strongly recommend it for friends who are going there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, friendly-staffed and conveniently-located hotel”
Reviews.Author: FBG_72
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend in Istanbul, staying in a single room at Hotel Sultania - a sort of boutique hotel in the old part of the town, at a short walking distance from all the unmissable sights such as Topkaki Palace, Blue Mosque etc. To reach the new Istanbul with its restaurants and nightlife, the tramway stop is just around the corner or you can catch a taxi, quite cheap in comparison to other major cities in Europe. The staff at the hotel was extremely kind and helpful e.g. in making suggestions and reservations for dinner. Colours and forniture of the room were in Oriental style, very nice! Despite the room was on the first floor overlooking a small alley full of bars and restaurants, it was very quite.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: FuserS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect with everything they offer! The staff is very friendly and attentive, from the moment you enter the hotel, with their warm smile and greetings, until check out when they wave goodbye and give you a small gift. I have been to many hotels with bed & breakfast and none of them had such variety for breakfast, it's an open buffet with EVERYTHING you can think of. The rooms are well equipped with everything you need-even an iPod charger! I loved this place and did not want to leave. Thank you Hotel Sultania for this wonderful Istanbul experience, I really did "Feel Like A Sultan"!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: manal88
Reviews.Content: Sultania hotel was an amazing experience ! We chose this particular hotel for our honeymoon, and we are extremely pleased with the excellent service, helpful staff, beautiful hotel decoration , and amazing location ! The Blue Mosque,Hagia Sofia and all of the heritage sites are within walking distance from the hotel , and this is what even facilitated our tourism in Istanbul even more ! We shall be returning there soon inshallah !! Best wishes and regards from Manal Chamseddine and Amer Okeh - Dubai â™¥

Reviews.Title: “Nothing is too much! Thank you for a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Declanz
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Hotel Sultania and all we can do is sing the praises of this wonderfully located hotel staffed by the most hospitable people. The hotel is ideally situated right in the heart of downtown Istanbul and so is accessible to all the sights and sounds of Istanbul. The rooms are all unique and the shower area is an intriguing use of the room. We arrived late at night and were met at Sabhia Airport (a long way out of town) the reception staff could not do enough to welcome us. We were very happy to get into our very comfortable and well appointed room. I am not sure there is anything that they may have overlooked and we had the first of several good nights sleep in their canopied beds The next morning and every morning subsequently there was a smorgasbord of breakfast delights available. There can be no fault and the staff here were equal to reception with nothing being too much. Our memorable trip to Istanbul was only marred by the loss of a Kindle reader, however the lady manning the Guest Relations was more than able to assist in this and was able to locate it. Sadly it was back at the airport which meant another haul out there and back. There was a bit of a scam with the driver who wanted "parking" while we went inside to get the unit back when all he did was drive around the block. Obviously in three days we were unable to see all that Istanbul had to offer however, again the Guest Relations were extremely helpful and informative about things going on in Istanbul and what is a must see and do. In the end we were sad to be leaving Hotel Sultania and Istanbul, however knowing what we do now we will certainly be back and look forward to staying here again. This time we will eat at the Olive restaurant next door along with the New Hatenay, literally across the road. When we told our family about our trip I found that my brother is planning another trip to Istanbul and will be staying at the Sultania, again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lee853
Reviews.Content: everyone was very helpful. yummy brunch. location was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: tellyaddict
Reviews.Content: Came in March 2012 to attend the World Indoor Championships. The hotel didn't disappoint in any way. We booked a transfer to the hotel - no problem, guy was there for us. Check in - no problem, we took a seat at reception while we were checked in. Luggage taken to room for us - nothing was a problem. The Turkish Delight on arrival in our rooms was a lovely touch. The rooms are gorgeous, spotless, and the beds are exceedingly comfortable. don't like the pillow? No problem - they have a pillow menu! For the next few days, anything we wanted booked, wanted advice about, wanted information on - everyone was there to help. All members of staff were invariably pleasant and helpful - something you don't get in chain hotels or indeed in most other countries i've been to. Staff at Sultania made you feel like you were the only guest in the hotel. Breakfast is lovely, great options. The spa is also highly recommended. I'm a massage addict and the massages I had were amazing. I'd go back to Istanbul for them alone! A lot of the major sights are within walking distance. The location is spot on. There are loads of restaurants in the vicinty, you'll be spoiled for choice. I don't think it is possible to get a duff meal in Istanbul, so anywhere you go will be fabulous. The Olive restaurant above the hotel is fantastic. There really are not enough adjectives in the dictionary to describe how fantastic Hotel Sultania is. I'm getting married later in the year and want to return to istanbul on my honeymoon - and I have no doubts about where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the heart of Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: annapolisgal526
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at Hotel Sultania for 7 nights in March, 2012. We found the hotel' location, staff, breakfast, and accommodations to be outstanding. From the front door of the hotel, the Spice Market is a 10 minute walk; the Hagia Sophia , Blue Mosque, and Topkapi Palace are a 5 minute walk; and the Grand Bazaar, Booksellers Market and Univeristy area are a 10 minute walk. The area felt extremely safe, even at night. The tram stops about 1 block from the hotel; my daughter and I used the tram to go to other areas of the city when we did not feel like walking any more. Hotel staff were courteous and most helpful with any request. Our room was on the small side, but adequate for two people with large suitcases. The decor added to the charm and ambiance of this hotel. Breakfast was sumptuous - the best hotel breakfast I've ever had, with a seemingly endless assortment of fresh fruit, vegetables, home-baked breads and pastries, eggs, meats, etc etc. All in all, it was a delightful place to stay, and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great weeks break in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Barbara N
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7nights after seeing the hotel on the web and loved the rooms and the location! On arrival we were not disappointed with either, the rooms were quirky, with them all being named after a different local character.My friend had her birthday while we were there and the hotel staff excelled in making her day special, with balloons and rose petals in the room and cake and candles in the restaurant. The staff made our stay very special, nothing was too much trouble. Loved the rooms. clean, tidy and very comfortable, great area to stay as access to all the popular tourist sites, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace etc. We travelled around using taxis and the tramway, both were ease to access from the hotel. I would love to go back to Istanbul but only if we can stay in the Sultania.

Reviews.Title: “The Best.”
Reviews.Author: Macandcath
Reviews.Content: We made our first-ever visit to Istanbul for an off-season break, and booked the Sultania for 5 nights based on web reviews and a look at a map of the location. The hotel is really great. It is close to Hagia Sophia and Topkapi Palace; only 10 mins walk from Galata bridge and the ferries; and only about 10 minutes walk from the Grand Bazaar (if you don't get lost!). The nearest tram station is also only a couple of hundred metres. The hotel is supremely clean throughout. There are plenty of staff - all of whom were very friendly without being intrusive. They were also always willing to help with directions, tickets or information. Our room was very, very comfortable in every way, and with interesting and slightly quirky, decor. The extra little touches made a significant difference Check-in was a relaxed affair where one of the first questions was if we would like a drink (very welcome beer after a long day travelling). The day we checked in was my wife's birthday. We didn't mention this, but we'd been in the room about 10 minutes when a cake complete with candles was delivered to the room! Check-out included a conversation, a handshake, and a gift for my wife. The hotel has a pool, and a well-equipped gym. There are bathrobes and slippers in the room and towels with the pool attendant. Breakfast was good. Very, very good. Take your time! We've stayed in many hotels in many places. We decided we liked this one best of them all. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel * great location * friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Leokhan
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at hotel Sultania & stayed in a double room with balcony, on the 5th floor. The room was gorgeous, very clean and each room had a theme and a story to tell. Breakfast was very complete, there was just about everything you can imagine. The hotel staff are happy to help you, polite, discreet & thoughtful, for example the morning of our departure we left very early, so they packed a breakfast picnic for us at 5am !, another evening we needed some information about the area & the receptionnist was more than happy to look on the internet with us and help us with our map, we also celebrated a birthday and they surprised us with a birthday cake. As for the area, perfect it's a 5 min walk from all of the big monuments Aya Sophya, Sultan Ahmet, Topkapi & 1 min away from the nearest tramway stop. We had a great time at hotel Sultania & thanks to them our stay in Istanbul was fanastic, HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rest!”
Reviews.Author: DmitriiKulikov
Reviews.Content: When I flied to Istanbul our flight was late on an hour and a half. Whether have already started to worry the driver will wait us to bring to hotel. All doubts were vain. We were expected by the young man in a suit, has politely greeted and has conducted to the machine. As we with the girl flied to Istanbul in honor of March, 8th, I have asked in advance, that in number there was a bouquet of tulips and a champagne bottle! To happiness of my girl there was no limit - tasty champagne and an excellent bouquet. The hotel personnel has worked perfectly well! Numbers were cleaned every day, breakfasts were very tasty. There were only the most pleasant impressions of stay in this hotel! I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marie715298
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Sultania just overnight after a long cruise. We were very pleased . The staff was wonderful and efficient. Bed & linens were extremely comfortable and clean. It had a very unique shower door. We loved it! There are two restarants on the premises. We had lunch in the downstairs one and dinner on the rooftop. Lovely views from the top of hotel. I frankly enjoyed the downstairs restaurant more. It was very friendly. After waiting quite awhile for our steak sandwiches, we found out they had to go buy the meat. The sandwich was delicious. We laughed at this as it reminded us of an old movie. We got some DVDs from the lobby and settled in for the night. The electric went off and we started the movie again, after a little while the electric went off again. We just cracked up laughing and went to sleep. Breakfast was just downstairs and had a great variety of foods. I had rose jelly for the first time and I loved it. Walking outside was a little hard on the uneven cobblestones. There were no cars on our street. That was a pleasure. No stinky exhaust! The decor of the room is just what you see on the website. Very unique indeed. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A++JUST PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: Prodromos-Maria
Reviews.Content: Second time in this hotel and sure i will be back third fourth etc Is a must stay hotel that you must visit All the people are wonderful and with a big smile!!!!!! Eylul and Boris are the new friends we make!!!!!! See you again

Reviews.Title: “One of the friendliest Hotels I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Lori_83_12
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sultania is a terrific hotel. Upmarket but not ridicuously priced and the staff without exception cannot do enough for you. Their courtesy was apparent as we walked through the door ready to spend the last two nights of our big Turkey trip. It was also my 50th birthday during our stay and Eylui and all the restaurant staff were very helptul to my husband in organising some treats for me. The room was exquisite with lots of little Turkish detail and courtesy Turkish Delight! My husbabd took advantage of the Health & Wellbeing Centre and was delighted with his massage from Mustafah - perfect after 100s of miles driving around Turkey! The breakfast buffet includes everything you could want from traditional Turkish to European continental - you can even order your own bespoke omelette! In practical terms the location is perfect too. In the middle of some good restaurants but more importantly 5 minutes from the Topkapi Palace and 10 minutes from the Aya Sofia & Blue Mosque. We also walked over the bridge to the Galata Tower and Taksim Sq which only took us 30 minutes. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for its facilities, decoration and hospitality. Thank you Sultania - a birthday never to forget!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HampshireKitty
Reviews.Content: Can't praise this hotel highly enough, we were made to feel so welcome from the moment we stepped through the doors. Our room was stunning and very clean. All of the staff without exception were friendly and helpful. The location is perfect for all the tourist attractions.We ate a couple of times in the Cafe Bistro the service was excellent and good value for money, on our last night we went to the Olive Restaurant on the roof top which was throughly enjoyable with lovely views. Would recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of going to Istanbul. Hopefully we will return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, great location - cannot fault this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AnitaAmitaB
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel from 22nd-29th February and we had a marvellous time. The friendliness, attentiveness and professionalism of ALL of the staff really made our stay special but I would have to single out Eylul of Guest Relations (so friendly, fun and helpful) and Arafa (always polite, friendly and nothing was too much trouble) for special mentions. Why is the Sultania so special? The rooms are really pleasant and comfortable (note, I loved the bed so much I could barely get up in the mornings!!), the shower - excellent. The decor is opulent and the rooms spotless. Our request for an extra reading lamp and extra towels was attended to promptly. The breakfast buffet from 7am - 11am was varied, delicious and of high quality. The spa facilities were spotless and I thought the hamam was very good. The location of the hotel could not be better - it is in Sultanahmet next to the Haggia Sophia, Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar - all within easy walking distance. The hotel is also vey close to the Gulhane tram station so it's also very convenient if you want to go further afield. On a personal note, my birthday was on 25th February and I was thrilled when the staff sang me happy birthday and presented me with a gorgeous cake in the morning. It made the day extra special and I can't thank the staff enough for the trouble they went to (Special thanks for the expert photographer on the staff who took and emailed me photos). Thank you to all at the Hotel Sultania!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for the first time”
Reviews.Author: Natalia1150
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Istanbul and in Turkey in general and I didn't get dissapoint about this hotel. Staff is very friendly, professional, smiling all the time, polite and were always ready to make my accommodation even better. I was impressed with the breakfast, it was very variable: a lot of fresh fruits, pastries, big choice of hot drinks as well. I liked my room as well, especially when I could change the light to make my room more cozy. Room is fully equiped: tea/coffe facilities, mini-bar, iron and iron-desk in the room, bathrobes, cosmetics, a lot of towels. I will definitely recommend this hotel and stay there again during my next trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. This hotel is simply fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CLHScott
Reviews.Content: There is nothing negative I can say about this hotel. The staff are helpful, polite and professional; the rooms are gorgeous and plush; it's always spotlessly clean; and the breakfast, which is served for a full four hours each morning, is absolutely delicious. Lastly the location is ideal for daytime viewing of the main tourist attractions, most of which are in the same neighbourhood, and is also very handy for getting across the Galata Bridge and into Beyoglu, where you will probably want to spend your evenings. I was expecting a lot less but actually this place beat my expectations. My partner and I agreed that it my be our favourite ever hotel, and we have stayed in really quite a few. Loved this place and, when we go back to Istanbul, will definitely be rebooking the Sultania.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be better!”
Reviews.Author: Oostkamp-travellers
Reviews.Content: Words are too short to describe this hotel! Located in a quiet area but very central. Just 2 minutes walk to the tram stop or 5 minutes to the Sirkeci train station. Sultanahmet is about 15 minutes walking. The Egyptian bazaar only 10 minutes, so everything is very close. The reception in the hotel is very cordial and friendly. Before you realize your luggage is already in your room. We had a family room and that was simply beautiful! The two adjacent rooms are very nicely decorated, very comfortable. The bathroom was very original (glass wall) Very pleasant was also the possibility to make tea or coffee in the room. Every day a little surprise: fresh Turkish sweets. About the breakfast there are nothing but good things to mention: extensive and very tasty! The pool is not big, but the water is hot! Also spotless clean. Decision: a super hotel where I'll be back and that is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Pat0808
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sultania for 5 nights in February. Truly excellent hotel. The location was very convenient for seeing the sights of Istanbul. The room was clean, comfortable and delightfully decorated in the Turkish style. The breakfasts were more than ample and delicious. But best of all was the staff--incredibly hospitable, knowledgeable, and efficient. Staying at the Hotel Sultania was one of the highlights of our trip to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: AucklandBlue
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in early December. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Room was good, decorated nicely and plenty of space. Very clean and had a modern feel. We wanted to take a cooking lesson so the staff arranged for us to use the kitchen upstairs at Olive restaurant. SPent a few horus creating soem authentic dishes which we then ate in the restaurant with the head chef. Nothing was a problem.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in the heart of the old city”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this hotel in any way given the location and value for money. All of the staff were so friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived through to our final departure. It is so refreshing to appreciate staff who have all been well trained to such a high standard and who obviously take such a pride in the service they provide for their guests. The free courtesy car laid on by the hotel that took us to the airport was a fitting end to this positive experience. I would highly recommend this hotel for people looking for a comfortable base in which to explore the old city particulary out of season. Our room was extremely comfortable, well designed with plenty of space to chill out after a day's exploring. Thank you for providing us with such a memorable introduction to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pepi2010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Sultania for 9 nights in January. The hotel is wonderful, exceptionally clean and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel is well placed to see all the sights of Istanbul. You have a tram stop only a few hundred metres away or you could easily walk to some of the major sights such as Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque or the Cistern (even when snowing!). The room was spotless, and extremely well maintained and very quiet. The buffet breakfast is excellent with a fantastic selection of both turkish and western cuisine. As it got dark early we also ate at the Hotel Bistro (which is also the breakfast room) and the quality of food and service was excellent (must try the turkish coffee or the turkish apple tea at breakfast). Hotel room service is food from the Bistro (just a smaller menu), however the food quality and serving size is just like the Bistro. Whilst I didn't try the Hamam, the massages on offer were excellent. The Hamam/Fitness area is also extremely well maintained and a lovely place to relax after a long day of sight seeing. Special mention must go to a few staff who made our stay very special - Baris (Bistro), Murat (Breakfast & Bistro), Irina (best massage ever) and Vedat (Lobby Cleaner). We would definitely stay at the Hotel Sultania again without hesitation and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Fantastic, Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: riky221
Reviews.Content: What a gem! The hotel is so well situated. Any member of staff couldn't do enough to make our visit so perfect. Very easy to walk to many of the sites. I wouldn't hesitate to go back. Thank you..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: KarlosBoston
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the staff are incredibly helpful. Note: the Family Room only has one bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Oasis in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ninawyo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Sultania for 4 nights February 2012. Firstly, the location is excellent. You are so close to the Blue Mosque, the Tokapi Palace, Aya Sophia, etc. You can easily walk to many of these locations, or take a cheap taxi if you don't feel like walking. But besides the location, the hotel is lovely. Modern and funky, yet Turkish as well. My room was comfortable, and the small things like fresh Turkish delight left out every day, as well as lovely Turkish bathrobes was great. And I second what everyone else has said about the breakfasts! I always expect a little fruit, rolls, maybe some cheese. But they put out a spread! All sorts of cooked food, turkish tea or coffee, fresh orange juice, almost a dozen bread choices, yogurts, fresh fruits, honey off the comb, cheeses, olives...it goes on. The main thing about the hotel was it's staff. I arrived in Turkey with a cold, which unfortunately, turned into a chest infection. Everyone at the hotel knew I was sick, and they all tried to help. One made me warm milk and honey, another made me tea with fresh lemon, honey, mint, and lastly, a staff member made sure I got to the doctor. They were all concerned and lovely. I was traveling alone, so it felt good to know they were looking out for me. It is a lovely hotel, and I would stay again in a heartbeat. My one and only negative is that they don't have bathtubs. Fantastic showers with fancy showerheads, but no baths. I do love a bathtub! But I know there is a pool and sauna, so maybe that would make up for it Thanks Sultania for a caring, comfortable and lovely trip.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable wonderland”
Reviews.Author: Akiyoshi N
Reviews.Content: I arrived at Istanbul by air early in the morning, but I could check into the hotel soon after arrival, 10:00. The room is exotically sophisticated and very clean with furnitures of Turkish taste and a comfortable bed. Breakfast including Turkish traditional coffee and tea is splendid like a jewelry box. And more importantly all the staff is so kind and friendly. They all made my feel at ease. I recommend this hotel to everyone who visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “simply amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: M L
Reviews.Content: we stayed at sultania 4 days in feb 2012! location is perfect, walking distance to bosporus, topkapi palace, hagia sophia and blue mosque, even grand bazaar is not far! the staff is very nice, really helpful! we would recommend sultania to anyone who is planning to go to istanbul! see you again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: ShamimKarmali
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Would come back and stay here again. Excellent places to eat and very central location

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful quirky hotel”
Reviews.Author: eidub
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights in January. The location is excellent and within walking distance to the Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace etc. There are also lots of great restaurants in the vicinity, not to mention a good pub called the North Sheilds! We were given a warm friendly welcome by reception staff and offered some Turkish tea or coffee before being shown to our room. The rooms are lovely, each named for a different sultaniya, complete with painting of said lady on the wall and a scroll telling her story. Our room was nicely decorated with a very comfortable bed and large bathroom. The breakfast was excellent with a wide variety of foods to keep everyone happy. We had dinner one night in the Olive restaurant which is the rooftop restaurant from the sister hotel just next door. This restaurant has wonderful views of the Topkapi palace and blue mosque and the food was gorgeous. The decor in the restaurant was very bland and boring though and would benefit from a makeover. Two weeks later we found ourselves in Istanbul again for the night following a holiday in thailand. Due to bad weather in turkey we missed our connecting flight from Istanbul and rather than stay in accommodation provided by turkish airlines, we were delighted to take the opportunity to stay in the sultaniya again. We were warmly greeted as returning guests and were given an even nicer room this time. Room 1401! Has to be seen to be believed. It's lie something from 1001 nights complete with mirror on the ceiling. We loved it! We couldnt recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Joshuamony
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in end Jan 2012 over the weekend for 3 days Was impressed with the warmth of the staff when checking in and their responsiveness and sincerity. Rooms were very nice, comfortable, clean and charming. The staff was very helpful in explaining to us where and how to get around including the cheaper ways of moving around. Breakfast was a nice spread and the service during breakfast was second to none. We purchased a tall lamp & the the shop we bought it from did not pack in a box. The conceirge and manager went out of their way to get it wrapped and packed so that we can check it in. And they did not even charge us for the packaging material that was purchased. A good test of a hotel and a stay if whether you will come back again and recommend to friends. Well definitely will stay here again and I have already recommended this hotel to friends planning a stay in Istanbul. My wife and I really liked our stay there despite the freezing snowy weather

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Saglongfi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for birthday/anniversary. Nice welcome and gift in room. Free transfer from airport appreciated. Balcony room not fully appreciated due to snowy weather ( good to check forecast in future) but pleasant if a little small. The hotel is very clean and quiet, breakfast is good and staff good and in a great location for sites etc.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Antje W
Reviews.Content: Absolutely awesome. Perfect location only a couple of minutes walk from main historic attractions, great service, beautiful room, extensive breakfast buffet and free afternoon tea and cake. Beat my expectations even after having read previous reviews on Tripadvisor

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: saskia34
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. Nice rooms, delicious breakfast, good spa and friendly staff. They even surprised my boyfriend for his birthday with a cake! Thank you hotel Sultania.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: scott_harvey30
Reviews.Content: Good value for money to stay here. The rooms are big and clean, bed is comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nikcheh
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel the very best among all the ones I stayed in Turkey. Excellent service, such clean well decorated rooms, great location, amazing breakfast buffet and great value for your money. You can't go wrong with this choice. I had the best time ever. And don't forget to go to their rooftop restaurant "Olive". It is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Jahoeman
Reviews.Content: Really original, this hotel, strange but fascinating styling. Good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for a special days in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: We spend some days in Istambul in January. The weather was cold, but it was compensate for the warm hospitality of the Hotel Sultania staff. All of them are very kind and friendly. It's very well located (five minutes walking to the Ayasofya and Sultanahmed Camii). The installations and facilities are excellent and modern. Breakfast buffet assorted, abundant and delicious. All the information and pictures of it's web are absolute real. We do recommend the Sultania Hotel for couples who want spend some very special days in Istambul (as our case). We really appreciate the special details they do to us.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: Khalilaleker
Reviews.Content: My experience at this hotel was totally awesome. Firstly, my wife and I arrived way too early to check it. In fact 5am, and we were so tired they gave us a room to rest in at no cost! The staff were friendly, helpful and so kind. The food was divine, the location was perfect. 1-3 minutes away from Topkapi, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Mcdonalds, shops and the Metro. 1-3 minutes walk! Depending on how fast you walk. Breakfast was good. My wife enjoyed the Spa Treatment. Everything totally good value for money. Will definitely come back! Oh yes, they speak good English which I feel is very important.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nico B
Reviews.Content: Beginning of January 2012 we stayed at Hotel Sultania. The hotel can be recognized by a very friendly staff and nice rooms (at least the one we had). We were well received on arrival. As well every other day the staff was friendly and helpfull. Breakfast was good in amount of choices and had a great view! In summer this hotel must be even better (although our stay in winter was very good as well) The room was clean, nicely decorated and had good features (DVD, Ipod music docing station, good TV, etc). The hotel is very good located. Close to the major attractions and close to the metro when you would like to explore other parts of Istanbul. We loved staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly ambitious charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Swedish_Mark
Reviews.Content: We had a great time and were amazed by the standard for the prize we paid! Real friendly and enthustiastic staff!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: KEITH TRAVEL AGENT
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here from the 10th of january. The location is amazing, very close to all the attractions. Topkapi is just 5 minutes walk and there is a tram stop 1 minute away!. The welcome was incredibly warm with no hassling or pushing for anything. The hotel is immaculate, and the room we had on the 5th floor was amazing. Very large room with everthing you need (beautiful flatscreen tv, I pod, CD recorder, beautifully diffused lighting, minibar and marble bathroom with Italien shower. The bed was comfortable and the linen very white! The satff were all helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet was very complete too, with good coffee and real orange juice. Even the pool was warm, if a bit small, but the hotel is not very big so normal. All in all a great stay. Will definately recommend, and go directly there if I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding on all levels”
Reviews.Author: Dubsy1212
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a 13 day stay in Turkey -- about half of which was in Istanbul. For 5 nights prior to, and over New Years, we stayed at the Hotel Sultania. We were so impressed with the facilities and service, that after we had toured Cappadocia & Ephesus, we returned for two nights prior to our flight back to Toronto. The location is excellent. About a 10 minute walk to the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Basillica Cistern & Hippodrome. And a 15 minute walk in the other direction to the Galata bridge and Egyptian spice bizarre. It is located on a beautiful little cobblestone path away from the busy streets and is surrounded by outstanding little restaurants and patios. The service was also outstanding. From the moment we walked in --the assistance the staff gave with luggage, helping out with making reservations and suggesting things to do, to just generally being welcoming and concerned that you were enjoying your stay -- I cant say enough about the people working there. Relative to the facilities. The rooms are a good size (we stayed in a double deluxe), was very modern and clean and generally quite comfortable. There is free wireless internet (just get the username and password from the front desk), a nice pool/gym/sauna/spa area, a very nice breakfast buffet (complete with hot & cold options -- very nice perk), and a great restaurant on the 6th floor rooftop with a wonderful panoramic view of downtown istanbul. We had a fantastic stay, and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay @ Hotel Sultania”
Reviews.Author: LauraLiza
Reviews.Content: Our city trip to Istanbul was just amazing, also because of our stay at Hotel Sultania. On the 4th of January we arrived at the hotel, to stay there until the 9th of January. During our check-in we already got spoiled with Turkish tea and dried fruits, a good start! After dropping our luggage in the room (which looks just like the pictures on the hotel website), it was just a 5 minute walk to the Hagia Sophia, the 'Blue Mosque' and the Topkapi palace. At the end of a busy day in the city of Istanbul it's really relaxing to dive into the hotel pool (small, but sufficient)! And after having had a good night sleep, the next morning's breakfast helps to regain your energy. The breakfast buffet is diverse and offers all kinds of fresh fruits (try the pomegranate). Need some inspiration for sightseeing in Istanbul? Just ask the kind guest relations manager at the hotel lobby. Every day of our stay, she came up with really good ideas! Our stay at Hotel Sultania was just wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great service in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CJStamfordUK
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here with my partner over the New Year. The hotel was lovely with staff to match. The rooms were of ample size and were lovely and warm with great decoration. Everyday we were left a small present of Turkish Delight which was a nice touch. The breakfast buffet was top quality with a whole range of fresh bread, fruit and cheese to choose from. Staff were friendly and attentive. The Guest Relations member of staff was excellent and always on hand to answer any queries. The Health Spa with traditional Haman, sauna and swimming pool were a great addition to what is a fine hotel in the centre of the historic city. Well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Brilliant Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: paulo747
Reviews.Content: If your criteria is location, location, location then the Hotel Sultania is the place to stay. Its excellent situation means you can easily walk to all the atractions of the ancient city by turning left outside the hotel or the waterfront by turning right. The city is intriguing and absorbing, so much to see, a fascinating experience. As for the Sultania itself it has a fabulously themed concept, the rooms are luxurious, possibly a little over the top but the atmosphere they conjur up works brilliantly, fantastic fun! We were a bit dissappointed by the shared top floor Olive restaurant, there are much better places to eat within a very short walk, in fact one of the best was a little place right opposite the hotel entrance. The hotel breakfast was very good though. The hotel staff were immensly friendly and efficient and provided outstanding levels of service. The hotel is located on a cobbled street with no vehicle access so is very quite. You need to just walk around the corner for taxis. We had a great stay and would not hesitate to recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, very charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: MyHazel
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel nearby all the ancient attractions. Tram only three minutes walking. Very nice "turkish" room with all facilities. No sounds from neighbours or from the street or traffic. Perfect breakfast, perfect staff. Everything is clean and good kept. We stayed at new years eve and they made a wonderful party which we will not forget! Thank you, mister Sultania. Also the restaurant downstairs as well as the Olive restaurant has a very good kitchen. Fresh cooked food prepared with passion. Top hotel with personal attention!

Reviews.Title: “Best service on earth in an unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Ianfi
Reviews.Content: I don't like to be a high maintenance guest at a hotel, but my girlfriend and I placed a lot of demands on the Sultania staff during a recent 4 night stay there. Questions about tours, requests for directions, cabs, medicine when we got sick... I would have gotten annoyed with us. But the staff at Sultania could not have been more kind or welcoming. Whether it was the warm greeting upon check-in, the rose petals on the bed, the great advice, or the enthusiasm for us pillaging the scrumptious breakfast to feed the neighborhood cats, we have never had better service. The hotel's location is perfect: close to the tourist areas but a little quieter, near good restaurants, and peaceful at night. Although we initially found our room on the cozy side, we quickly appreciated the smart design and the incredible comfort it offered. Of particular note was the amazing shower and linens. As mentioned, the breakfast was phenomenal, and our room service dinners from the hotel restaurant downstairs were fantastic and very reasonably priced. The downstairs spa area and gym were also very nice, though there was a slight problem with the hot tub temperature when we visited. On the whole, though, Sultania eclipsed any hotel we've visited around the world, including five star stalwarts like the Four Seasons. We spent our final nights in Istanbul at a different hotel that also placed at the top of TA, and while it was serviceable, there was just no comparison. The Turkish standards of service are quite high, but the Sultania blows its competition away. It's the best of the best.

Reviews.Title: “They made my stay unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: mariaorohctga
Reviews.Content: What else can I say about this hotel? A lot has been said already. But I'm glad I selected this hotel over Neorion, Amira, and Erboy. Here's why. 1) Exceptional Service: I was over there on the 25th. The hotel staffers went extra miles to make us feel a little Christmasy in a predominantly Muslim nation. Hotel guests were given complementary Christmas cookies (I found them on my bed in additional to a daily supply of Turkish delight) and tasteful music (flute?) was played at the lobby. When I needed a ride back to the Ataturk, a staffer ended up having to call a shuttle company many many times b/c the line was always busy. He did it for me without showing any irritation or frustration. 2) Location: As in real estate, location, location, location. I walked to most major spots by myself. (The only exception was a tram ride to Dolmabahche...I could have walked had it not rained.). Topkapi, Spice Bazaar, New Mosque, Blue Mosque, Sulaymaniye, Brand Bazaar, Archaeology museum, ferry docks, Galata... I was even shocked b/c they were actually closer than they looked on the map! 3) Safety: If you are a female solo traveler, your personal safety should be your priority. I never once felt unsafe or uneasy in the neighborhood. In fact, I walked alone around 10 p.m. well after the Turkish Dance Show was over at Hodjapasha Cultural Center (which was also in the neighborhood.). There aren't many annoying people asking you to buy something or asking you to come to their restaurants. It's totally different from the Sultanahmet area (esp. in front of the Blue Mosque/Aya Sofya area). In fact, I came to enjoy a mini-chat with a restaurant owner (across from the hotel and Pashazade) every day who jokingly deplored that I didn't want to eat in his restaurant. 4) Exotic decor: Where else but in Sultania could you enjoy being like a real Sultana? It will be a once in a lifetime experience. Then, why not take advantage of it and enjoy? Some may dread the neon light in bedrooms as shown in some pictures. But don't you worry. Unless you do, they won't turn on automatically. I came to like it, though. 5) Breakfast: I have never eaten better than I was at Sultania. Every morning I woke up and I was like "What will I get to eat today?" Plenty of fruits, Turkish bagels (my new found love!), pastries, eggs in different styles, fresh juice, tea, coffee, cold/hot meats, veges. Oh my Gosh...I really miss their breakfast. They serve breakfast until 11 a.m. so don't worry about having to get up so early on your vacation. 6) Windows: Huh? Why might a hotel guest complement windows? Well, I love to hear a call to prayer but not necessarily so early in the morning. Once I shut the windows, I never heard any street noise....even though a restaurant in front of my room was open till late. In any case, seeing is believing. I'd go back to Sultania in a heartbeat. Oh well, I need to save money first!

Reviews.Title: “Best service”
Reviews.Author: mlddrss
Reviews.Content: A lot has been said about Hotel Sultania in reviews already. I just want to add that the best feature of this hotel is the exceptional service attitude of everybody there. Staff goes of their way to be helpful. Just one example - we forgot our bathing suits in the hotel room when leaving. Not only are they maling them to us, they refused to get paid for it. The Hotel is in walking distance to a lot of historic sites in Old Town, which make it an excellent base if you are interested in that. The ferries are also just a few minutes wall away as are Metro and tram stations. Taxis are quite cheap, but we made the experience that taxi drivers tend to cheat. One trick that worked on my wife two times, until she realized the third time what is going on, is - you give a 50 Lira note to the taxi driver who quickly changes it to a 5 Lira note and then claims that you have given him only 5.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice and value for a stay in Ä°stanbul”
Reviews.Author: dcruze
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two night.Amazing rooms. Great value for money. Very nice and helpful staff. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome”
Reviews.Author: Tranis
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this hotel. Nice, stylish rooms and great breakfast with many local specialities.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable”
Reviews.Author: john_tillett
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sultania is an excellent choice in Istanbul. The rooms are small but comfortable. Our twin room had two single beds, and a day bed. The room was large enough to accommodate our two large bags, just. The bathroom is essentially a walled off â€œpodâ€� in the room, and perfectly adequate. The breakfast was the best of our time in turkey. It was extremely fresh, and of a high quality. The swimming pool was larger than we expected, and warm. It did get busy in the early evening, given that it is shared with the adjoining hotel. Of special mention, the hotelâ€™s concierge is fantastic. She is there everday, and gave us excellent recommendations for our itinerary, and was helpful with booking restaurants. At check-in, the receptionist was unaware of a special offer on the website, and was fairly abrupt in his manner. However, other receptionists were excellent, and the included transfer, and free fourth night were provided.

Reviews.Title: “i am impressed”
Reviews.Author: BenjaminCosta
Reviews.Content: Being a frequent traveller,and being seen quite few places, it was hard not to be mesmerized by Sultania. At the centre of the magnificient Istanbul, where you exactly want to be, just a walk away from the top historic/cultural attractions of the city.location couldn` be better. Plus, as a niche boutique hotel, Sultania makes you feel the city in a different way which is very unique and elegant.Room is exactly what it looks like from the pictures.The welcome compliment as you go up to your room was very nice also. Sometimes the problem with the design boutique hotels is that they have the design but service is average but Sultania proved this wrong again, i experienced an outstanding service. The quality of sleep was great, breakfast was very satisfying and consisted of very well selected products and offered anything or more than you would want. And staff, they are very motivated to help you in whatever issue and keep you safe.You can feel they are trying to keep you satisfied every single minute which is comforting you. Also,on my last day i spared my time and tried out the spa in the hotel, you won`t be dissappointed. For night, having the dinner accompanied with a spectacular view of the city is a good choice. I will never think of staying somewhere else, this hotel is sure to give you the classy vibe during your stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for a short stay in Istanbul as tourists also for families”
Reviews.Author: Tripvictim
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortable, clean. The service people are kind especially the guest relations manager. The position in very central in Sultanhamet and close to main attractions as blue moskee, Hagia Sofia, cistern, spice market and so on. Rooms are clean and not quite personalized in turkish style. Good breakfast. There is also Restaurant and spa but we didn't try.

Reviews.Title: “No point in looking any further: chose to be a Sultan at Sultania!”
Reviews.Author: Alexutz_m
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our Istanbul break and everything was great. Do you want to feel as a sultan? Hotel Sultania goes above and beyond, redefying the concept of hospitality and confort. The experience starts with a nice ride from the airport to the hotel where you get a warm welcome from the Guest Manager together with Turkish coffee and Turkish delight (yes, all the hotels should have one though even if they do, it's pretty difficult to find somebody who does her job as good as this lady!). You are taken to your room and everything is explained, from the specific of your room to how to get to the SPA or how to use the DVD player. The room itself its beautiful, cosy and functional; the matress is really good and there's also a pillow menu. In the lobby there's always somebody to help you and always with a smile including the late shift receptionist ready to tell you some Istanbul stories or hot spots! The breakfast offers a wide variety and if you ask for something different, they'll prepare it immediately and you won't be disappointed. We've been to the SPA a couple of times. The gym and the pool are small but good enough. You HAVE to try the foam massage! The lady masseur does a wonderful job and she will really take care of you according to your body needs/ stress level. We also received a fruit and wine hamper for our last evening and before leaving I received another small personalized gift. The Olive Restaurant was nice but the food...normal. The view is great and probably during the summer it gets much better! The hotel is close to all the important spots and it's not a dangerous area. We've been on the other side of the Golden Horn and also to the Asian side. If you go, try their local places, you'll eat things not comparable to those from the "new" and cosmopolitan districts: we had a wonderful lamachun and also some kind of fish sandwich sitting in small Turkish places. What else? They've arranged a great staying for us at a reasonable price without hassle and problems. If you go to Istanbul, this is definitely the place to stay! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Ä°stanbul”
Reviews.Author: joluii
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, convenient location, excellent restaurants, friendly and professional staff. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jwave45
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hotel Sultania was wonderful. The staff make this lovely hotel extra special. Always friendly and helpful, they made our time in Istanbul special. Esp. arranging transportation (complimentary) for our 6am flight. A live person gave us a 3 am wake up call brought coffee up to my husband (again 3 am) and when we made it downstairs, there were 3 staff members ready to help, all smiling and friendly. Our room was beautiful (top floor with balcony) and HUGE. The bathroom is very large with a jetted tub and a rainfall shower (not separate). The balcony wrapped around a corner of the building and while the view is somewhat obstructed by other buildings it is nice. I relaxed with a book there a couple of times. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious with many American favorites but lots of Turkish items too. The coffee is VERY strong. I had tea. My husband LOVED the coffee. The food items were delicious. The location is VERY close to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Grand Bazaar and Topaki Palace. We even walked to the Spice Market, which is not as close. There are many small restaurants in the little side street the hotel is on (if you arrive by cab tell him it is on a side street..a no car side street). We particularly enjoyed eating dinners there.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Leona326
Reviews.Content: It's a really nice hotel with a perfect location. Grand bazaar, Blue mosque, Hagia Sofia are just a walking distance away and the tram stop is literally around the corner. Our room was large and with a nice "oriental" touch, however there was no view. The breakfast from 7 till 11, so a plenty of time to enjoy the selection of western and Turkish delights. The restaurant Olive on the sixth floor had good food and amazing view over the city. The spa was small, but good. Massage from the lady masseur was strong, extremely strong, but my backpain is gone :-) She, as the rest of the staff, were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely welcoming hotel. First class service”
Reviews.Author: Laheg
Reviews.Content: Location was perfect for sightseeing and frequent trips to the Grand Bazaar. Staff were excellent - friendly and helpful at all times. There was a mix up over our hammam and massage but this was handled brilliantly. Really good breakfasts too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: lian28
Reviews.Content: Great location for everything, about 10 minute walk to the Blue Mosque, the Bazaar and spice market, loved the atmosphere the people and Istanbul we stayed only three nights wish it could have been longer. The hotel was lovely smallish room extremely clean we enjoyed our stay there

Reviews.Title: “Great location, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: xinco
Reviews.Content: Perfect for someone looking for a great Istanbul old town location. Rooms are comfortable and very clean. The service was exceptional, breakfast buffet was great with lots of options. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl2006
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! It was perfect for someone looking for a great neighborhood and really comfortable rooms. The small touches such as naming the rooms and the amenities on the beds add to the experience. The neighborhood is a bit touristy (right near Topkapi palace) but that was fine with me because there were numerous dining options all around the hotel. The beds are comfortable and rooms are very clean. The service was exceptional, especially my driver from the airport who waited even though my flight was late and immigration took forever. The breakfast buffet was lovely with lots of options as well. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “thanks sultania's staff!!”
Reviews.Author: lelon
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel,clean,comfortable and great location. Helpfull and professional staff,good quality of breakfast and great dinner at Olive Restaurant. We had room # 1205,nice shower,ipod dock station,lcd tv and complimentary basket of fruit and cake on arrival. I think that there's nothing to change,congratulations!! and see you very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Ten Days in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: etse w
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were very impressed with the service we received in Hotel Sultania. The facilities were quite good and most of all the staff members were just superb - polite, helpful, jovial, friendly, examples of Turkish hospitality! The rooms were lovely decorated in a more traditional style giving you the feeling that you are in the middle of the long Turkish historical traditions; the rooms were cleaned properly and if as a customer you asked for further dusting or vaccuum cleaning, the staff obliged - the cleaners did not disturb you if you did not wish to leave the room for a few hours but were accessible to respond to your needs. The breakfast is generous and delicious - it gave you choices. Hotel Sultania is located close to the sea, museums, places to visit, shopping bazaars all walking distance from it!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service, Beauty and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: MorganClub
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the front desk services is excelent and the rooms are profesionaly decorated. The restaurants with a walking distance are amazing, the free breakfast buffet on the terrace has a diferent main course every morning, the wait staff is frindly and warm. The location is one of the best locations in town, within a walking distance from the blue mosque and the Sofia, the metro system is a block away, if you feel like walking by the water is just a couple blocks away. The location is safe and the price is just right.

Reviews.Title: “5 star hotel at 3 star price”
Reviews.Author: Heidi S
Reviews.Content: Perfect locatoin in quiet street with plenty charming restaurants - walk to all the sights. Rooms are tastefully decorated, comfortable and clean. Friendly staff, great breakfast and charming spa area.Very reasonable rates and complimentary airport transfer in very luxurious and spacious minivan. Calculate the cost of transfer and realize this is a BARGAIN! You cannot go wrong with this one - but book early, word is out....!

Reviews.Title: “Live like a Sultan (almost)”
Reviews.Author: ulpa_10
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Istanbul and we could not find a better place to stay than Sultania. When we are abroad we like to have space around us, so we settled for a Sultania de luxe room which showed out to be huge and actually as big as a suite. Well, the price was not low but we were staying in Istanbul a whole week so our hotel room was momentarily our home. After a long sight seeing day it is wonderful to relaxe in a spacious room. The position of Hotel Sultania is as good as the room: you are not only extremely close to all the famous attractions of Istanbul (Topkapi, Aya Sofia, The blue Mosque, The gran Bazar etc.), you are also very close to the bridge over The golden Horn and thereby the access to the many boats going up the Bosporus. And furthermore close to the real life of the Istanbulies who are swarming around the area in the afternoon and that's what we really like: to mingle with the locals and get a glimpse of the life behind the glamorous facade of a city or a country (within limits of course). The hotel staff were attentive, skilled and extremely serviceminded. The nice lady in charge of guest relations was specially helpful, she was there with the purpose of giving the guests good advices about Istanbul, which is a rare function in a hotel. The breakfast was abundant and also the restaurant Olive on the roof top was good. All together and following many of the other reviews: a great hotel in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in turkey”
Reviews.Author: HassanTeetoo
Reviews.Content: I'm not kidding. Fantastic if your up for romance. Good breakfast. Happy well fed staff

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location....a winner!”
Reviews.Author: VonKrieger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Sultana in the fall of 2011. To cut to the chase, we loved it. The room was well sized, clean, interesting and had an ethnic flair, which we enjoyed. The staff was great (don't miss the Turkish bath offered by the hotel), and without exception they were very helpful. The complimentary breakfast provided enough food to keep one going all day, the quality was great and the selection varied. Moreover, the location is perfect, as it is within walking distance to many of the must-see sights in Istanbul. Noto Bene: the neighborhood is a little confusing, so be sure to drop bread crumbs when you leave the hotel. However on the plus side, I felt it was a very safe area. I would stay there again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish delight”
Reviews.Author: arm673
Reviews.Content: The hotel was difficult to find for the taxi as it is new and on a pedestrian only walkway. Beautiful boutique hotel on a great pedestrian walkway full of restaurants and shops. helpful and knowledgeable staff and a restaurant overlooking the city. Funky decor in the room ours having mirrors on the ceiling a free form sink and a jacuzzi in the bathroom. However we felt it was overpriced and managed a little clinical and efficient rather than warmth.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for your Istanbul stay”
Reviews.Author: vjw011
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Sultania, we were impressed with it. The staff were very welcoming and the rooms easily ranked four star. Our beds were very comfortable and each day the lovely Bergul (our room/floor attendant) aranged different and gorgeous origami-type folding of our bed cover. We even arrived back one day to find she'd arranged our Turkish scarves in this way at the foot of our bed. The litle touches like this made us love the Sultania even more. The location of the Sultania is perfect. It's about a 10 minute walk to the all-important bazaar, and close to many of Istanbul's other attractions. We easily walked everywhere. Our room: There was plenty of room to move around. Each room has everything you'd expect from a four star hotel. A few people here have commented that the bathroom set up is not ideal for friends who are sharing but we didn't find it a problem. You can only see shapes through the decorated glass and that's only if you try hard to see. We were on the fourth floor next to the lifts and there was no night noise to disturb our sleep. Bedding was warm and snuggly, pillows were comfortable, and everything worked as it should. The free wi-fi was excellent. We ate breakfast in the hotel's dining room each morning - it was included in our price. The food was good and the variety was lareg enough to keep most people satisfied. The little pancakes with raspberry sauce were my favourite. I highly recommend the Sultania to those planning a stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Sultania”
Reviews.Author: Ed_Mississauga
