Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 4 days from Oct.21-25. Nice location. All attractions in the old city are within walking distance. Tons of restaurants around the hotel. The guest relation lady is the best we ever met; she is experienced, very helpful, sensitive and knowledgeable. If you need any info on what to do, just ask her, she will take the time to explain to you what you should do. She is definitely the big plus for the hotel. Other services and breakfast are average, compared to the other hotel (Conrad Instanbul) we stayed before Oct. 21. Bathroom area is small and the room we stayed have water coming out during showering. We asked the hotel to fix it but with no luck. There is no AC (is off for the season I believe) and we need to open the window to cool the room. Taxis cannot reach the hotel directly, one has to carry the lungaage down a small road, may not be a good choice if you cannot carry the lunguage on you own. Also the taxi driver has a hard time finding the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A real jem”
Reviews.Author: leftygolfer0
Reviews.Content: We booked this on a recommendation from our travel agent and did not disappoint. Location, rooms, and staff are very good. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for a week's holiday in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: mikethevet
Reviews.Content: Situation excellent, very close to the Big 3 - Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia. Front desk staff all helpful, resolving a problem we had with our transfer company, recommending local travel arrangements, and booking restaurants for us.. Room very good, in very romantic Sultan style, with good facilities, a very comfortable bed with choice of pillows, and daily maid service. Restaurant, we only used it for breakfast but fou d a good selection of foods, including many local delicacies and lashings of Turkish tea. We would recommend the hotel and would happily return

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay!”
Reviews.Author: Stillwater20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Sultania in the first week of October, 2011. The hotel had come recommended from our local travel agent who knows us well and as usual, she was spot on! Its a stylish hotel with lovely rooms in a quiet side road in the old town. The hotel is brilliantly situated bieng within walking distance of Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque, a Bosphorous trip and both the Grand Bazaar and teh Spice Bazaar. What places this hotel ina league of its own is the staff - they are all extremely helpful, efficient, friendly and nothing is too much trouble! The Hotel is a great base to explore the city and I would highly recommend a stay here. You must try the Spa and the hammam experience - superb! Thanks for a fabulous time in your beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “BRAVISSIMO”
Reviews.Author: Magnus V
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 9th-16th of Oct. Just perfect everything. Very easy to recommend the hotel to friends and for sure the hotel will be the first priority next time we visit Istanbul. From a couple living above the Artic Circle in Norway

Reviews.Title: “perfect turkish gem *****”
Reviews.Author: travelerman32
Reviews.Content: this i a beautiful place to stay ,our room was just perfect,and cleaned everyday,the staff were fantastic ,very helpful and happy, anything no problem, the restaurant was top class with fabulous views at night ,when istanbul lights up. the hotel is a great base to explore istanbul, with only minutes walk to the grand bizzare, wow. it's so romantic ,a must for couples. also loved the spa ,at the hotel just great, we will be back, thanks to you all for a great break.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Justin R
Reviews.Content: This is a stylish hotel with all modern amenities in a great location (lots of restaurants and walking distance to the main sights). The old town is definitely the best place to stay, lots of life and things to visit on foot, but not as crazy as around Taksim at night. We all loved the decor and the staff made us feel super special. We got an amazing deal (4 nights for the price of 3) which made this great value for such a cool boutique hotel and top-notch accommodation. The bathroom design doesn't give much privacy, but luckily that didn't bother us once we got used to it. Stylish and special, we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “great value central location”
Reviews.Author: romabene
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 5 night stay in this hotel. When we arrived ,4 women sharing 2 rooms , one room had a double bed instead of twins but they put an single bed in for us immediately and the room was still quite spacious . They also gave us a free bottle of Champagne and a free transfer back to the airport because of the inconvenience. Breakfast was good but would have liked to have a bigger selection of prepared fruit eg papaya and bananas and also croissants which I love but there was a good selection of other breads and pastries . The service was great and all the staff very friendly. Rooms were good but bathroom setup not really suitable of women sharing as sink was in the bedroom and there was no privacy in the bathroom due to design. had a Turkish bath and massage and it was well worth the money. All in all I would go back to this hotel and recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around”
Reviews.Author: HappySwan
Reviews.Content: Love being in the old town, the staff was very nice, the room brand new and great value for money. The breakfast selection lovely with freshly squeezed OJ & real honeycomb. The rooftop restaurant at the sister hotel next door has fab view of one of the mosques.

Reviews.Title: “1 of the best hotels in the country”
Reviews.Author: nicole295
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Istanbul. very convenient location, excellent staff. clean and comfortable rooms, excellent breakfast. I am very happy for such small money it was great.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: leslee60
Reviews.Content: What stands out most about the Sultania is the service. The staff is excellent and eager to please. The concierge, Sibel, gave us excellent suggestions on restaurants and other attractions in the old sections and other areas as well. A special treat, not to be missed is the Hamman. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, nice rooms, friendly staff, right price.”
Reviews.Author: TomD65
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in September. The location is fantastic and within minutes you can walk to major historical attractions. A bit further but still walkable to the spice and grand bazars. Rooms a very clean and comfy, and the service outstanding. The little street that the hotel faces is great wandering out for late dinner or drink. I highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding Hotel in which to enrich your visit to Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: Linda W
Reviews.Content: The beautiful Sultania hotel and the fantastic service by the whole team (to name a few: Huseyin, Mesut, Kahraman, Sibel and Erdem) made our visit to Instanbul one of the best memories one could have. The advice and willingness to help at any time of the day was exemplary. The buffet breakfast was one of the best we had experienced in our seven week European vacation, from freshly squeezed orange juice to how to make real turkish coffee whilst enjoying your breakfast. We stayed in a balcony room with a modern marble bathroom. The room was spacious and well decortated in a Turkish theme. We felt like Sultans and will book the Sultania without hestitation the next time we visit Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Great location”
Reviews.Author: Marby1
Reviews.Content: We had an oportunity to stay at Hotel Sultania for 1 night, prior to a Med. cruise. Even though it was just one night, the hotel did send a driver to pick us up at the airport. Our flight arrived at 10:15am, we got to the hotel by 11:30am. We were greated with a warm welcome. As we checked in, they brought us a beverage and cookies. They appoligized for not having the room ready, but said that it should be ready in 20 minutes. As promised, the room was ready within 20 minutes. Our room was lovely. We requested a room with a balcony, which was located on the top floor. The following morning we stepped out on the balcony and saw our cruiseship! The hotel is very well located, walking distance to all the important sights. The street is lined with great resturants and shops. We couldn't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: G0Lightly_2011
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Istanbul and was impressed with the other reviews on Tripadvisor. The hotel is set in a perfect location - easy walking distance to the main tourist sites - Blue Mosque, Palace to name a few. The hotel is small and the staff really helpful. The rooms are decorated in Ottoman style and equipped with all mod cons. The breakfast is really good and the swimming pool is nice. Slightly annoyed at having to pay 10 Euros to use the sauna when staying at the hotel. Fully recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent First Experience”
Reviews.Author: RobCarolyn
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Turkey and this boutique hotel was recommended by our travel agent and turned out to be everything that we had hoped for. A lovely hotel right in the middle of everything - 10 minutes walk to Grand Bazar, Spice Markets, more mosques than you know what to do with and the main shipping tourist port for Instanbul plus so much more. Also very close to the tram line which provides very good transport options. The room was huge and very up to date and in excellent condition with well stocked mini bar, large wall mounted TV and serviced to the highest standard each day. Although being in the thick of things the room was very quiet at night, curtains provided absolute darkeness and air conditioning worked extremely well. Bathroom was good size and water pressure very good (one of my bug-bears in many other places!) The front desk staff always went out of their way to be helpful and accomodating with information of local tourist spots, tips on money access through ATMs and following up on booking details for us quickly, efficiently and in a helpful and friendly way. Utilised the in-house restaurent for breakfast and dinner and the food and service was excellent. Food very fresh and breakfast buffet provided a huge range of choices. All the staff were friendly and polite and appeared genuinely pleased to have us staying with them. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Instanbul, Turkey and also Turkey in general

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel near Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: CatalinaCorbeanu_11
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sultania surprised us in a very pleasant way, although our expectations were quite high, considering the TA reviews. Location: Perfectly located, on a small street (which offers you quiet during the night & day), just 3-5 minutes from Topkapi Palace and a 7 - 10 minutes walk to Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. Service: the staff was very friendly and helpful, especially the concierge, who gladly helped us with money exchange, directions and even dinner reservations. Cleanliness: rooms and common areas are perfectly clean and well maintained. Rooms: some are very small (like ours), some are quite large and spacious (we saw some of them while they were cleaned), but what makes the hotel unique is the turkish style of decorations - not in bad taste, but with a traditional twist to all the furniture and ambiance. Breakfast: quite a large selection of food (different cereals, milk, yoghurt, hams, cheese, jams, eggs, sausages, vegetables au gratin, turkish tchai (tea), coffee, fresh juice (you have to squeeze the oranges yourself!), olives, tomatoes, cucumbers etc) + a large selection of deserts. Distance to Ataturk airport: 20-30 min taxi ride from the airport. Truly recommend the hotel...it offers you the home away from home! PS: as far as visiting, do not miss a trip to Buyukada (Prince's Islands) - especially the carriage (fayton) rides! + climbing into the Galata tower - it offers a spectacular view! Enjoy Istanbul! Catalina

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Cost X Benefits”
Reviews.Author: Kaschu_BR
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sultania is located in the heart of Sultanahmet neigborhood. Within a short walk distance you are able to reach any of the most important touristic attractions from the old town. It is very easy as well to reach Grand Bazaar and the Egyptian Bazaar - excellent for shopping. The hotel is very confortable, although the decoration is a bit overwhelming. The room has all amenities you may wish for, and it is extremely clean. The breakfast is rich and delicious. One positive point is the Olive restaurant at the rooftop - you will be able to get a delicious turkish meal with a marvelous view of the Bosphorus and Hagia Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: BOLondon_Ontario
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and loved Istanbul. There was so much to see and do. The hotel was clean, and in good condition. The staff were friendly and the front desk helped us out with every question. We had a private walking tour which was worth it. We also did an eating tour of a section of Istanbul which was unique and excellent. The grand bazaar was worth seeing. We spent a few hours there and that was good enough. We walked the tarlabasi street at night and ate at a small street off tarlabasi which was a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Malcolm B
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end, our 5-night stay at this hotel was wonderful. We were picked up at the airport, greeted at the hotel with Turkish coffee and various nibbles, discovered complimentary fresh fruit and wine in our spacious and delightful room, and were treated to two meals in the hotel restaurant together with complimentary afternoon tea/coffee. Also included in our package were two tours. The central location of the hotel meant we could walk everywhere we wanted to visit. All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and we were very sad when we were taken back to the airport. However, we shall certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Jackson1374
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fantastic trip to Turkey (Sept 2011). While in Istanbul we stayed at the Hotel Sultania, a smart hotel near many of the tourist attractions. The rooms were sparkling clean, the staff were helpful and attentive, the location was excellent and the breakfast was delicious and filling. Most staff understood English (a little or a lot, depending) which was helpful for me since I did not have much of a command of the Turkish language. You can even try on reproductions of Sultan era clothing for some special pictures if you want to amuse yourself and your friends back home. I would highly recommend this hotel to others as a great place to stay in vibrant Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anne172
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the brilliant reviews it had received and I was not disappointed! This is an excellent hotel in a great location in the old city and is only a minutes walk from Gulhane tram stop and 5 minutes walk to Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. The rooms are beautifully designed and decorated in Ottoman fashion. The beds were extremely comfortable. Every day complimentary Turkish delights and water are left in your room. The hotel is cleaned to a very high standard and the breakfast buffet has a wide range of cold and hot food. The best thing about the hotel, however, is the wonderful staff. They are so welcoming, friendly and attentive. Requests are dealt with speedily and nothing is too much trouble. Ozlem, guest Relations, was available every day to help with any query and with general advice or directions. She asks every day if everything is OK and if anything more can be done to make your stay better! My sons and I stayed for eight nights and one of the main reasons we had such a great holiday was because we loved the hotel so much. There was tea and coffee making facilities, a mini-bar, free wi-fi in the rooms, a dvd player, an Ipod docking station and the TV had several English channels. It was great to get back to the luxury of the rooms and the pool, turkish bath and sauna after a busy day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Sylvikins
Reviews.Content: The family room was great for a family of 4. Hotel's location was excellent and allowed us to walk to everything. The restaurant was great (dinners and breakfast buffet - the children loved the mezze). Would definitely stay here again as the excellent service the staff provided was what made this hotel stand out. Kids very much enjoyed the pool at the end of the day (even if it was very small).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Enrv
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely boutique+ hotel in a first class location. Ideal for the main attractions. Has a great spa and the staff are helpful and friendly. Rooms have a lovely individual feel and we were staying in a cheaper room on a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: LA12345
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at this hotel. The location is fabulous, close to all the major sights, and within walking distance of the bazaars, and Galata bridge. Very nice breakfast. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was a trifle small, with no view, however, it had a Hamam style shower, which was interesting. Next time, I'd probably prefer a terrace and a view, and repeat my visit to a real hamam, which was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacek p
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Sultania last month (August 2011) for 4 nights.We have enjoyed our time in here,the room is very comfortable and had a lovely bathroom with powerful hot shower and also very friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: johans057
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in an excellent location with some of the most beautiful rooms I had the pleasure to stay in. Would be 5 stars except they forgot the promised pickup in the airport (we waited for 45 min before taking a taxi) and checkin/checkout was very slow. But everybody was super friendly all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BlackXJ6
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Sultania for five nights on a motorbike tour around South-East Europe. This was definitely the best hotel I stayed at during my tour, but, admittedly, it was also the most expensive one. The hotel has a very nice location in the Sultanahmet district, with easy access by foot or tram to many places of interest, and surrounded by lots of restaurants. The hotel's own roof-top restaurant, Olive, was rather good, and it provides excellent panoramic views over the city. The room rate included a rich breakfast buffet that offered a wide variety of dishes, and the selection was different each day. This must have been one of the best hotel breakfasts I have ever had. A fitness room and a swimming pool were at guests' disposal free of charge. Sauna, hammam, and massage were available for extra fee. The sauna was all right, but, in my opinion, the water in the swimming pool was much too warm for a refreshing effect. The hotel has a small garage, but I was told there was not any room for my motorbike. I was advised to leave my motorbike on the pavement where it was visible from the reception. It looked rather a safe location. The hotel staff was outstanding. Especially the people at the front desk were extremely professional and courteous, made me feel welcome and accommodated my every request. Whenever I entered the lobby, they greeted me politely and, unless busy with other guests, they entered into a friendly little chat about good food, motorbikes or my continuous adventures. I can recommend this hotel without reservations. I would stay here if I travelled again to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: giselle s
Reviews.Content: We stayed at hotel sultania for 2 nights and it was a very comfortable stay. The rooms were nice and clean. The bathroom was a good size. There were a lot of varieties of food at breakfast, but we didn't really find anything we liked too much on the first day. However, on the second day, we decided to try more things and eventually found things we liked.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: brianjkoscuiszka
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our honeymoon, which we started at the Hotel Sultania in Istanbul. From our pick-up at the airport to our departure 5 days later, the staff of the hotel went above and beyond to make our time special. Check-in to our room was quick and easy, the concierge gave excellent recommendations for food and excursions, and the rooftop restaurant offers fantastic views. The hotel is ideally situated, a short walk from the Sultanhamet district (where the Hagia Sophia and blue Mosque are located), the new district (shopping), the waterfront, and other local sites. Outside of our transport to and from the airport, we were able to walk to each and every site we visited, saving money on transportation and getting to see some diverse neighborhoods of Istanbul. The only complaint we'd offer is that the beds weren't the most comfortable, but as we traveled to more areas in the region, this seemed to be the norm and might just represent a shift from what we were accustomed to in America. The hotel did offer a "pillow menu" with various options that could have made a difference, but we were so tired from all that we did that we still slept well. Other than that, the hotel met and exceeded ALL expectations and we cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves all its rave reviews”
Reviews.Author: Hdeborah
Reviews.Content: Room decor fantastic. Tea, coffee and water provided. Good quality soaps, gels etc. Proper coat hangers! Excellent variety at breakfast buffet including the ability to freshly squeeze orange juice. Staff dedicated and SO helpful. We are recommending this hotel wherever we can and will definitely stay again if we find ourselves in Istanbul. It is so convenient to walk to the main sightseeing attractions. One thing to note, complimentary transfers to/from airport only apply if you book through their own website.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent way to enjoy Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: lyoso896
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. We booked a double room and they upgraded us to the family suite which was huge! Turkish delights on arrival and the rooms even have a pillow menu with 5 different types to choose from (as you do). All the usual amentities and lovely accomodating professional staff. The breakfast was amazing. Freshly squeezed orange juice, pancakes and honeycomb. Definitely a great way to start the day in the buzzing city of Istanbul. Only downside: WiFi went out while we were there as they were apparently servicing it (haven't heard that one before). They did offer the restaurant's WiFi details next door but the signal was so weak it wasn't worth it. Really easy to get to. We just took the metro and tram from the Ataturk airport and got off at the GÃ¼lhane tram stop. The hotel is only a few minutes walk away (3.5TL one way).

Reviews.Title: “Great hospitality and location!”
Reviews.Author: FavoriteWalks
Reviews.Content: Everybody at the Hotel Sultania made our first trip to Istanbul extremely comfortable - from arranging for a private guide the first day, to recommending fantastic restaurants, and just being available for a chat about the town. This is a small boutique hotel - the fourth family run hotel in this district. It has a restaurant - The Olive, with views of the Bosphorus and Hagia Sophia on the property which I'd recommend if you do not feel like venturing out one night. Breakfast is included with fruit salads, fresh honey and thick Turkish yogurt, eggs with mushrooms, tomatoes cooked as well as fresh with cheese, breakfast meats, cereals, fresh OJ etc. Many restaurants are within a short cab ride or walk. The metro runs nearby, so if you want to use this system, it is easy to reach the Dolmabache Palace or Museum of Modern Art. Locally the Sultanahmet district has nearly everything you'd want to see on a first trip - The Topaki Palace and Archeology Museum, the Hagia Sophia and the Sultanahment Mosque (The Blue Mosque), The Basilica Cistern, The Turkish and Islamic Art Museum, the Egyptian Spice Market and the Grand Bazaar. Istanbul is hilly and has lots of cobblestones, so if walking is an issue for you, take a cab. Cabs are reasonably priced and can be arranged by the hotel. Be sure to see Istikal Street, a pedestrian thoroughfare starting at Taksim Square. Also the Cultural Center is about three blocks walk from the hotel which hosts a highly rated dance performance as well as performances of the Whirling Dervishes. We had a beautiful room with a balcony on the fifth floor which had a large marble bathroom. It had a queen and single bed, and was great for a small family. Some of the rooms have very small bathrooms with little privacy, so if that is an issue for you, get a room with a hamas (larger bathroom). The restaurant recommendations from Ozlem and the staff that we had were really good -- Topaz and The Ottoman Palace were restaurants that we visited for lunch. Topaz is uphill from the Dolmabache Palace with a wide open terrace overlooking the palace and the Bosphorus. Ottoman Palace is near the Hagia Sophia and is also worth a visit. Asitane Restaurant is contiguous to the Chora Church and has a walled patio covered with vines and good Ottoman cuisine. Quiet live music at night. I think that the church closes at 6:30 pm, so you could arrange an early dinner afterwards or lunch before a visit. The Hotel Sultania felt like home for our week's stay.

Reviews.Title: “Turkiye cok guzel! Berna Auckland New Zealand”
Reviews.Author: Bernie B
Reviews.Content: I love Istanbul, this is definitely the perfect place to reach all those amazing historical musuems and places of interest. I had a room next to the lift on the 3rd floor, it was so quiet, in general it was heaven to stay here. The young woman who cleaned my room was "more than amazing". Nothing was too much trouble for her, so polite and went out of her way to ensure that I was as comfortable as possible. A good tip for any traveller, if you need a shuttle service, ask the reception for the service that picks up travellers from various hotels, do not ask for an independent transfer as there is a huge difference in cost. Will definitely recommend this place, breakfasts were also really good and there was a variety.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect and Ozlem is my hero”
Reviews.Author: Mishnin79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what I needed. The decor is gorgeous, very clean, perfect location, the terrace bar is cosy and the whole hotel was welcome retreat for a solo female traveller. The staff were very friendly but I must say a huge thank you to Ozlem who looked after me when I lost my bank card at Ataturk airport. She went above and beyond and actually tracked it down for me. Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Hotel for exploring old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshire_Exec
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week for five nights and it was as good as the pictures suggest. The staff were friendly and courteous, breakfast was akin to a feast with lots of choice and a juice squeezer to squeeze your own orange juice. We ate in the restaurant on our first night not wanting to venture out and whilst the service and food was good it lacked atmosphere and we left a little bit disappointed, but as you an see from restaurant reviews there are loads on the street outside. Next door is a gem! This hotel is great for exploring Istanbul with all the major sites less than 15 mins walk away and the tram stop is five mins away if you want to go further afield or just use transport. Our room was great and looked just like th hotel pics on the website and we had a great time here so would highly recommend you stay here if coming to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: AandAW
Reviews.Content: We arrived pre Breakfast last Sat and the staff were amazing. Brought us coffee whilst we waited and then, whilst we were having breakfast they had one of the rooms cleaned after an early departure. By 7.30 we were checked in and free to shower, change and sightsee. Throughout our two day stay the staff were impeccably friendly and helpful. Rooms are reasonably spacious, quiet, clean and well appointed, although we spent most of our stay out and about. We only ate breakfast at the hotel which was very good. A great stay and a comfortable hotel perfectly situated for the best sightseeing in Istanbul. We would definitely return and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the neighberhood!”
Reviews.Author: stars1983
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Istanbul for the 2nd time and we wanted to stay in the sultan Ahmed area this time. We chose this hotel and we couldnt be any happier. The staff are young professionals that give you great advice. The rooms are so cute and romatic and clean. Service is amazing. and its just around the corner to all public transportation and walking distance to all historic places and the Bazar. would def stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing find - great staff, lovely room and terrific value!”
Reviews.Author: rbinsydney
Reviews.Content: Trip advisor has done it again - we just loved this place. They unexpectedly sent a car to pick us up from the ship (complimentary, and very welcome gesture!!); which began the Sultania experience - they just can't do enough to please. The very moderate price, (which decreases if paid in cash) includes breakfast, which was more than adequate; free wifi in room and public areas; delightful themed guest rooms with delicious treats under a small metal dome waiting on the bed. The rooftop restaurant and bar (Olive) has great views, particularly at night, but we didn't dine here. There is also a spa downstairs with a gym and small swimming pool, so we had a great massage for a very reasonable price. As our flight was late in the evening, they gave us late checkout til 2pm, which was much appreciated. This is just excellent value for money and we wouldn't think of staying anywhere else next time. Also the area is delightful with masses of great little restaurants (including no. 5 on trip advisor directly opposite!)

Reviews.Title: “A super hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: weltaltburger2
Reviews.Content: The first sign of the professionalism at the Hotel Sultania was the email we received a week before arrival from Ozlem the guest services manager. It was a really nice touch and showed that they care about their guests. The hotel driver was waiting for us at Ataturk Airport and was friendly and helpful as were the staff at check in. . We were taken up to a large L shaped room (corner) with sitting area, big bed and balcony and shown where things were including the plasma tv cunningly disguised as a mirror! The bathroom was fine, though as in most Turkish hotels, there was no plug for the wash basin, a mystery we've yet to solve. Everything was spotlessly clean and well maintained. We appreciated the tea and coffee making facilities in the room as well as the daily replenishing of the Turkish delight bowl (it's nothing like the coloured jelly stuff you get in Australia, this is excellent!) Breakfast was good, with eggs cooked to order plus a wide choice of Turkish and European foods. Special mention to the lovely Ozlem, who is the first guest services manager we've ever met who really does her job. She couldn't have been more friendly or helpful and went out of her way to give advice and make forward hotel bookings for us. The rest of the staff were good too. The little bag and fridge magnet given to us on departure was a nice touch.....it would cost them peanuts but such a nice little souvenir. The Sultania is well located for major tourist attractions, handy to the trams and restaurants. We'd happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of old town of Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: gianninijrn
Reviews.Content: Thumbs up! Nice, clean, updated rooms. Walking distance to everything. Easy access to the train. Staff was helpful. Breakfast... Could have done without it. Otherwise, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JackJack-1976
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great and we can't say enough about it. We stayed in a suite with a nice balcony. The room was spacious and clean, with a comfortable bed. Breakfast and wireless Internet were included. Breakfast was very nice, with a nice selection. We requested a late checkout and they were able to accommodate. Had an excellent massage in the spa. We should also mention that they picked us up at the airport free of charge. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: coffeegirl54
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel Sultania! Near the Topkaki Palace. The bath room is a little odd, with the shower door and bathroon door the same door. It swings one way or the other. You have to like your roommate! Otherwise, great hotel. Give you an example. When we left, the bellman mistakenly onitted one suitcase from our taxi to the airport. We didn't notice enroute to the airport. The hotel called our taxi driver and made arrangements for another taxi to bring the missing suitcase to meet us at the terminal. How's that for responsibility? I was entirely impressed with that level of care. Very nice stay. Loved it and Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet refuge in the Old City Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: theinvestmentcoach
Reviews.Content: At the end of a Black Sea cruise my wife and I spent three enjoyable days in Istanbul, one of our favorite cities in the world. The Hotel Sultania is on a quiet pedestrian-only street in the middle of everything. It is a 10 minute walk to the Haghia Sophia, Blue Mosque, and Topkapi Palace. The hotel is well-appointed, the rooms comfortable, the staff most helpful and courteous. The breakfast room is comfortable with cafe seating along the quiet street; the food is good. There are good dining selections right along the same street. Room rates are reasonable. It is a delightful spot and we plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sultania would be #1 on Trip Advisor if it had been open longer”
Reviews.Author: GingersMom66
Reviews.Content: We had the good fortune to stay at Hotel Sultania in early July and liked it so much that we stayed there again at the end of our trip, having originally booked another hotel. Ozlem in guest services is very friendly and helpful as is the rest of the staff. The rooftop terrace is a gem with a fantastic view of Hagia Sophia. The breakfast buffet is outstanding. The hotel's central location makes it very convenient for getting to all the main sites. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “TOP CLASS SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: Merali
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were first time visitors. We were a little paranoid about the hotels in Turkey, however we booked at Hotel Sultania. Turned out to be one of the best hotels i have ever stayed at, also its close to everything... we are a picky couple when it comes to hotels!..definitely recommend to all.. Oh and there is this lady who is in charge of providing all kinds of information for people who stay at the hotel... she is AWESOME!! a great team of staff to be fair...but she was the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Will definately go back.”
Reviews.Author: Fiona1958
Reviews.Content: What can we say that hasn't been said already !!!! Fantastic hotel, not for a moment did we think it would be half as good as we were led to believe. The room was just lovely & very comfy, we were a bit shattered after an overnight trip to our departure airport & on arrival the lovely Ozlem, made us feel increadibly welcome & continued to do so for our entire stay. The rest of our visit was great, very close to everything, saw as much as we could but didn't have enough time so will be back, will only stay at the Sultania now, we have been spoiled & don't think we would consider anywhere else in Istanbul. Will see you all hopefully sometime in the New Year, Many thanks for a wonderfull stay, big hug for Ozlem you are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Khursheed
Reviews.Content: hotel sultania is an excellent boutique hotel in Istanbul, its location is very good, very near / walking distance from all major historic locations. rooms are very well decorated, very clean and comfortable. room service and food quality is impressing. staff are extremely cooperative and friendly. hotel provides pick up from airport.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will definitively recommend to all our friends and family”
Reviews.Author: France011
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay in Istanbul! Perfectly located near major attracttions. The staff is extremely nice and helpful, specially the concierge Ozlen who was friendly and even offer a little souvenir to my daughter and myself. Rooms are clean and very confortable. P.S. breakfast is nicely presented with great choice and excellent quality. Sultania is THE PLACE to stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: desertdoccsm
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its excellent location and because of its many 5 star amenities (flat screen tv, ipod dock, down pillows and high thread count sheets, robes, marble bathrooms, free in-room wi-fi to name a few.) What I did not expect was the wonderful staff. They are incredibly friendly yet professional. They accommodated my every request including a 7 am check-in (such a relief after a long flight!) When I contracted food poisoning at a guide book recommended restaurant on French street, Hussein at the front desk brought me water and extra blankets and checked in on me every hour or so all night. They even offered to take me to the hospital or call a doctor. The next morning the adorable concierge, Ozlem, was very concerned for my well being and later called the offending restaurant and gave them a serious talking to. I will always return to this wonderful hotel when I visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved it... one of the best hotels we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: riky221
Reviews.Content: We were here for a wedding and from the moment we arrived, we experienced outsanding service. The rooms were absolutely as the web said they would be. We also had a meal in the roof-top restaurant. The views are amazing for the sunset. The location is perfect for walking to all the key sites and the tram. We regularly asked for information but would particularly mention the Guest Services lady who was outstanding and what an ambassador for Turkey. We loved it and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing!”
Reviews.Author: grumpybones
Reviews.Content: Staff and atmosphere provided in this boutique hotel are just amazing. Rooms are extremel comfortable, themed (Sultan's hareem!) and stylish, enhanced by the latest technology. Breakfasts are superb and the cafe/bistro high quality. All staff uphold high standards are friendly and courteous and a credit to the management. You are treated very special!y

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Couldn't have imagined better!”
Reviews.Author: jules0010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sultania for 6 nights after travelling around the rest of Turkey for 2 weeks and I am so glad I chose this hotel to cap of my tour. The staff are all incredibly friendly and helpful, especially in finding your way around the city and to the sights. The complimentary breakfast was one of the best I've experienced anywhere. The photos shown on the hotel website are identical to what you get. The single room I had was very large and clean and comfortable (king size bed!) - which made it difficult to leave the room. The different kinds of pillows offered really go the extra mile in making you feel at home. The shower, oh the shower with two shower heads! If I could take that shower home with me... couples you'll enjoy it too. The spa/pool was nice and clean. Next time, I'll stick with just the scrub/sudsing service though. I wasn't overly thrilled with the massage (but this really depends on the person). The location was central to everything, on a small street that isn't driven on. A lot of restaurants around. The Olive Restaurant was yummy and the service was incredible. I would definitely recommend staying in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Man, I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travel184
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good about the Sultania. Very luxurious and at a great price. Perfect location for visiting the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul. Very close to the tram which takes you pretty much anywhere you want to go in Istanbul. The staff and concierge were wonderfully helpful, making reservations and suggestions. The rooms are very lovely, clean and elegant. There is a pool and spa area with hamam. Terrific. The breakfast was wonderful with lots and lots of choices. Sultania is a very lovely oasis in which to relax after a busy day of touring around Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: FluffyViv78
Reviews.Content: More by luck than judgement, the Sultania ended up being much more centrally located than we expected - so much so that we spent much of the first day walking round in circles, but I think that's a feature of Istanbul! Lovely hotel - clean and friendly with everything you could want right on your doorstep. The restaurant was fantastic although don't necessarily be fooled into going to the roof terrace. The views are spectacular but it's enclosed and the menu is the same whether you're six floors up or sitting at the much more atmospheric street level. Rooms are a decent size, with an interesting shower/toilet screen contraption which actually gave a lot more privacy than you might expect. It was spotless, well stocked mini bar, four different types of pillow to choose from and some nifty accent lighting which gave us a good fifteen minutes of fun! Breakfast was varied and served at sensible times, although stick with the Turkish treats - this is not the place to indulge your love of corn flakes. Staff were extremely attentive and well equipped to guide you round the city. I would also highly recommend a cocktail or two when you stumble back late one evening - the Istanbul Seven Hills in particular packed a significant punch after sidling up to you disguised as apple juice! Lovely - highly recommended especially for those visiting the city for the first time and wanting to be close to all the major places of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lhlitt
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is great....great rooms, great location, great staff, great breakfast! We stayed here for 4 days in June and could not have been more pleased!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for getting under the skin of the old town”
Reviews.Author: RichWandsworth
Reviews.Content: I sort of knew this would be good just from the booking experience, I was messing around due to changing numbers on the weekend but nothing was a problem and everything was very efficient. Very friendly staff, front of house was excellent with the concierge full of energy and so friendly. Hotel is new, very clean and very well kitted out. The Bathrooms are on the small side but very well equiped with modern fixtures and fitting. The rooms all come with ipod docking stations and flat screen TV's built into the mirror, pretty smart!!! and a reasonably priced mini bar. Hotel is spotlessly clean and make sure you go down to use the hidden gem that is the spa - really great facility and again the treatments well priced. The other feature that is worth checking out is the roof bar, there is a restaurant but Istanbul has so much to offer you may want to go and explore - but worth a beer or a glass of the local vino before you venture out. The hotel is located on a lovely tree lined street with plenty of decent places to eat and drink and a 10 minute stroll to all the sites. Great hotel, would certainly go back again next time I visit this brilliant city.

Reviews.Title: “We loved every minute of our stay and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Ani085
Reviews.Content: We loved every minute of our stay at the Hotel Sultania! The rooms were awesome and very clean. The service was out of this world! Everyone was warm and friendly. I can't say enough about the Hotel's hospitality. We have two little kids and they treated all of us like family. The breakfast which was included was delicious. It was buffet style with lots of lovely choices. The hotel was a short walk to all the major historical sights. We didn't have a chance to use the spa but it looked great! We miss our time at the Hotel Sultania and look forward to going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary,we will definately come back”
Reviews.Author: StellaThessaloniki
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at hotel Sultania! First of all,all the people working there were very kind and always did more things than the common to help. Ozlem,the woman in guest relations was very friendly,always smiling and always suggesting great places for dinner etc.Se also helped as with check in and other things.Men in the reception were also vey kind.The hotel is in a very good point,5 minutes walk from Ayia Sofia and Blue Mosque and 1 minute walk from the tram station ( the tram stop is Gulhane). Galata bridje is also very near,you can walk on foot.Rooms are exactly what they look at the fotos,the whole hotel is new,very clean and with great decoration.Hotel spa is also very good ( I had the 'sultan package') ,tukish bath in hamam and massage.Breakfast was also very good,fresh omelete of your choise,fresh squized orange juice,rose marmelade and many,many things!Also many useful facilities in the room such as slippers,coplimentary water,coffie and tea as well as some welcome sweets made our stay even better. WELL DONE,KEEP ON THE SAME!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaDoglover_50
Reviews.Content: I just loved this place. I'd rate it a 4.5 if not 5 star hotel. Rooms are exactly as you see in their pictures. Staff makes you wish staff at ALL hotels were this friendly and helpful. Neighborhood is right where you want to be as a tourist. There are a zillion restaurants and shops within a stone's throw. I don't normally give this sort of praise, but this hotel deserves it. Especially if you look at the prices of other 4 star and above hotels in Istanbul. AND great pool on the lower level! GREAT job, Sultania!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we ever visited!!!”
Reviews.Author: argyris23
Reviews.Content: As I say above Sultania Hotel is one of the best hotels we 've gone. We spent there our Easter vacations on April 2011. Starting from the personel everybody from the front desk guys to the cleaning guy all of them were so kind and helpful, with a smile on their face all day. We chose a sofa bed room, that had a huge bed and a very nice sofe by the window. The room, as the whole hotel, was very classy, clean and spacious. And very important quiet. The hotel is located in Sultanahmet in a nice pedestrian very close to tram and 5 min walk to Agia Sophia. I defenately recomend this hotel to everybody. Forgot to say it has a wonderful area for spa with a small swimming pool, hamam, sauna and rooms for massage.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Peach2102
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located near the palace, tram line and a short work to the Spice market and Hamdi restaurant. It is also located in a strip of restaurants, so plenty of choices for dinner. The staff are outstanding at this hotel. We were welcomed by friendly reception staff with a cup of coffee or tea and check in was very fast. The lady at concierge is fantastic, full of great tips and advice with a vibrant attitude. The staff leave a memorable impression. Breakfast is very good and includes some local treats. The rooms were a good size for larger suitcases and very well maintained. the rooms also have tea and coffee making facilities which is often lacking in European hotels. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Sultan Ahmet area”
Reviews.Author: aaangha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sultania for 2 nights on our way from Los Angeles to Tehran. It was a great experience. I highly recommend it if you want to stay in that part of town. Many things to visit during the day, but not the most happening place at nights. The room could be a little bit cleaner, but the design is nice. Staff members were very helpful and caring. I donâ€™t think there is any room for improvement there, couldnâ€™t get any better. They helped us to identify places to visit and places to hang out at nights with locals. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “last destination and perfect designed hotel”
Reviews.Author: ramon29
Reviews.Content: hotel sultania was our last destÅŸnation.when we arrival to hotel we were not sure which table is reception and young beautiful lady helped and showed us the reception which is designed with marble.Ä±t was unusal reception Ä± felt like on theater myself.Ä± walked on the red carped and catch to reception.receptionist stand up when see us and shook our hands and offered to drink turkish coffee.we sat to reception and chat a little bit.he explaind almost everything about hotel and city.after drinking coffee we took the elevator. all the rooms have numbers and sultans name it was good an idea.on the bed there was trukish delight and it was very delicious.room has been designed as like little palace.Ä± have never seen this kind of decoration during my trip.bed was very comfortable Ä± did not want to get up in the morning. breakfast was multiple choice and delicious.waiters were very hardworking and smily. Ä± had a problem with my shoulder and they recommend me massage and Ä± made reservation for wellness.after massage from professional masseur Ä± felt much better myself. their slogan was feel like a sultan.Ä± was not sure what does it mean but Ä± know very weÅŸll now because Ä± felt.thank you everybody for your great service.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of an Hotel”
Reviews.Author: happychappy75_11
Reviews.Content: We chose Hotel Sultania as part of celebrating our 50th Wedding anniversary and were treated like royalty by all the wonderful staff throughout the Hotel. The food and service was very good, with a special mention to Huseyin , Murat and Ebru whose friendliness and attention was outstanding and made our stay most memorable. We would recommend Hotel Sultania to anyone wanting to experience true Turkish hospitality right in the centre of Istanbul's most amazing sights.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: zman007
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sultania is in a great location in walking distance of all the major tourist attractions such as the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. Also for longer trips the Tram is just 1 block away from the hotel. The hotel itself has beautiful large rooms and a full free breakfast every day . The most outstanding feature is the customer service. Everyday the Guest relations girl helped us out with sightseeing recommendations , directions and delicious restaurants. I would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mayo Gal
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Sultania at the end of April. We had arranged with the hotel for pickup at the cruise terminal, and they were right on time. The hotel is charming, and we enjoyed our large room and the interesting bathroom arrangement. Breakfast was bountiful, and the squeeze your own orange juice was delicious. I was a bit apprehensive in regard to the location in Sirkeci, since it was described as down the hill from Sultanahmet and I was suffering from the effects of a leg injury. I was delighted to find that the hill was a pleasant walk and not very steep at all. Most of all, we were impressed with the entire staff, most especially with Mrs. Ozlem in guest relations. She provided us with excellent restaurant information, and went out of her way to locate us after we departed the hotel when our ATM card was brought to the hotel after it was found in a restaurant. Comfortable, pleasant and in a great location - we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A magical hotel in a magical city”
Reviews.Author: dorrie2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in lots of hotels but this is one of the best. The room was lovely-very atmospheric and romantic. All the staff-waiters, reception, concierge everyone could not do enough to help us. We liked it so much we are going back in February. The only thing I would have liked was a bath rather than a shower.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull hotel”
Reviews.Author: georgehookwell
Reviews.Content: me and my wife trevelled Istanbul and stayed at Hotel Sultania it is a fantastic location and very clean hotel staffs are very friendly it was a great plassure to stay there thank you everybody making our holiday fantastic

Reviews.Title: “feeling like queens”
Reviews.Author: brpadali
Reviews.Content: if you want to take a break from your 24/7 super-mom job, well a two nights' trip to Istanbul with your friends is the best choice and hotel Sultania is the best solution. The place is new, clean, well-positioned(walking distance to top sites and railway buses that drive you everywhere, we went on the other side of the bridge to see the galata tower ) . The rooms are beautifully decorated, but peculiar: the basin is in the room, and the toilet has glass-walls...so be sure you travel with your parther or very close friends! the service is great, the staff is very friendly.The Olive Restaurant at the top has a wonderful view and good food. The breakfast buffet is delicious...but the very best is the spa: the pool is ok, but if you really want to relax you must try the spa. You can choose from different kind of massages and have a foam bath (it's very intimate, not like the public bath).Then you can relax on huge sofas and drink your tea. It's awsesome! They really treat you like queens at Hotel Sultania!

Reviews.Title: “One word - perfect”
Reviews.Author: TrustyDublin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sultania for a 4 day trip with my husband in April for a sightseeing tour of Instanbul. The hotel is ideally situated for this, being only 5 minutes walk from the Blue Mosque, Cistern, Old Palace etc, and the tram stop for further sight-seeing. The hotel is lovely but what really makes it special is the staff. The staff at this hotel must be one of the most helpful I have ever come across. Every one of the staff members, porters, receptionist, Guest Relations, waiting staff are efficient, knowledgeable, helpful, courteous and friendly in the nicest possibe way. I hope the owners realise what an asset the staff are and appreciate them. The hotel is SUPER SUPER clean. The rooms may be a little small but not in any way cramped and they are decorated in such a fun way that this is just a small point. I had written ahead to say that my husband is a coeliac and the hotel had especially got in gluten free bread, much appreciated. Also one night they had a fabulous flour free dessert and my husband had to have two helpings. Not only did they not charge him for his second helping but by the next morning our waiter had provided a handwritten English version of the receipe. You could not pay for service like that. We ate in the hotel bistro, very good and also the Olive Restaurant. Both very good and food excellent. So go to the Sultania, and have a fun time, amongst the most pleasant staff you could ever meet. Thank you all at the Sultania. Anne and Paul

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: carobrooB-W
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights occupying one twin and one double room. Both were amazing and extremely comfortable. We ate in the bistro one night and The Olive restaurant twice. The Olive has amazing views and dinner was delicious and not expensive compared to other restaurants in the neighborhood. The staff were all fantastic and Ozlem was so helpful in suggesting places to visit. The hotel is near to all the well-known sights - just follow the tram line. The hotel has wi-fi and we could use our I-pad all over the hotel. Every room has an I-pod docking station.

Reviews.Title: “a real historical ambiance”
Reviews.Author: angramainyu
Reviews.Content: luxry,silence,good location,delicious breakfast, iron and ironing board in rooms (most important thing for a businessman like me)

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but smallish rooms, and a bit pricey for what it is”
Reviews.Author: FOL-1003
Reviews.Content: This hotel manages to benefit from tripadvisor like only a few i have ever seen in the world. once you been there, you see that the staff is nice and the location in the old town, not good for business, but great for the excursions. Low points are a really small room, where the shower door closes into the bathroom, fnacy but leaves the bassin in the room, so if you get up and wash your hands you are pretty close to the bed. Not my style. lots of funny and colourful decor with little use. Its 3*, charges 4*. WArning, the Olive Restaurant is dreadful, do not go. Check out Club 360 or Hamadi, all within close range.

Reviews.Title: “A great high end luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geroi900
Reviews.Content: If you have the money, you can't beat the Hotel Sultania. It features immaculate and huge rooms, beautifully decorated. I have never stayed in a hotel room quite that fancy anywhere in the world. The staff really bends over backward for the guests. I saw a tourist couple shamefully berating a hotel employee because a taxi driver (unaffiliated with the hotel) did not actually carry their bag into the hotel. The patience and self control of the staff member was awe-inspiring. How he withstood that totally undeserved tantrum without saying a word is beyond me. The concierge was very helpful to every visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aethelred
Reviews.Content: - and how it can be the #13 business hotel on tripadvisor is a real enigma to me. This is a compteley touristy hotel for tourists only in the main tourist area of Istanbul - and that was a bit my problem, because I was there on a business trip and it did not really cater to people like me. The hotel is one of six in one block that belong together and share some facilities (so a bit pseudo-boutique) such as the tiny pool and the rooftop restaurant. The good sides of the hotel included the very friendly guest relations lady; the general quality of the furniture and infrastructure, especially the good bed and servicable writing desk; the quite good breakfast, included in the price, with nice local selections; the free pickup from the airport; and the location for touristic purposes as well as close to a tram stop (GÃ¼lhane). Among the bad sides were that the room was often not made up in time and things frequently not replaced (cups, glasses); the thin walls through which one could hear even not so noisy neighbors; the generally not well-enough isolated windows; the erratic internet which always worked but often only after trying 10-15 minutes to log in; the partially overdone and slightly kitschy decor; the sink and washing facilities in the room rather than in the shower, which had too little space to put things; and for me, the location right on one of the main tourist streets of the quarter. The hotel provides an airport car service which costs slightly more than double a reliable taxi, which the reception will order for you. I would advise getting a high-up room facing the side street, but this means to either take the stairs or wait a lot for the very small and slow elevator - I still would think this the better alternative.

Reviews.Title: “wondyrful”
Reviews.Author: kamoliddin
Reviews.Content: I am a businessperson who does commerce. That is why I visit Istanbul quite often. The hotel in Istanbul is located near the centre and hospitality, cleanliness of them is very important for me. This time of my visit, I have surprised of their big, tidy and historically beautiful of room, which is like a real. In the restaurant of the hotel, meals made with naturally fresh vegetables and they are very nice and yummy. Also, you can visit historical places that are not far from the hotel. Servants in the hotel are very kindly and nice to the visitors.

Reviews.Title: “excellent staff and service”
Reviews.Author: glynna
Reviews.Content: i really couldn't recommend this hotel enough - location, staff, service - everything was excellent

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel set in a great location”
Reviews.Author: weekend34
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends at the begining of March. This hotel cannot be faulted great location within walking distance of all main sites. Rooms were decorated and kept clean to a very high standard . Turkish delight delivered to your room daily ! Break fast second to none ,but most of all the staff who were so friendly helpful and went out of there way to make your stay in Istanbul such a pleasure. We were a little disappointed with the roof top restaurant but so many good places to eat by the hotel that you have lots of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Kingdom of kindness”
Reviews.Author: alexpp12
Reviews.Content: First: I wanto to thank you all the staff, special to Ozlem for courtesy and availability. They are able to merge familiar and professional ways. In add hotel's location is perfect, in the hearth of Sulthanamet. Breakfast is adorable. Hotel is absolutely clean, large and confortable room in style. Really rare. I never forgotten them. Alessandro

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: PMMLondon
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed four nights at the hotel. We were impressed at the room; it looked great and was comfortable and clean. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. It was also in a great location near to the tram and Blue Mosque. The breakfast was good and there was a very varied spread of fresh cold and hot food. The only very slight downside was the wash basin which was in the bedroom rather than being in the bathroom. I'm not sure if this was just a feature of our particular room. I would have preferred this to be in the bathroom to keep the bathroom and bedroom areas separate. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “well hidden treasure in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ajturk
Reviews.Content: I travel often and have been almost everywhere in the world. I was on my way to Oman, Muscat after hopping in a few cities in Turkey. I live in the USA but am Turkish. Our standards are higher in the US in terms of service than most Europeans. My experience from booking my stay until the checkout was superb. Very rarely you will find a perfect hotel. This is one of them, best boutique hotel, very close to most attractions you will want to see in Istanbul. The rooms are wonderful, named after Ottoman Sultans. The front office personal can not be matched, with their enthusiasm, pride in what they do and professionalism. I teach tourism and hospitality management. These people do not need to attend any of my classes. They would have passed our classes with flying colors. I hope that they consider getting a masters degree or PhD so they can teach their skills to our future students. One thing that bothered me though was the unexplained humming noise from outside. There might have been repairs made. As a hotel manager I would make sure that these repairs are made, I would urge my neighborhood to finish them asap or do them late during the day. My Kudos to the people who run the hotel. Keep it up:-) One more thing. They did not charge my guest for breakfast. Free on the house. Nothing beats that. ANd they give you a little present on your way out. Pay cash, get a little discount.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning decor, excellent location, so-friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Fraser61
Reviews.Content: I endorse all the superlative reviews of this hotel - it really is as good as it sounds! The rooms are beautiful and cleverly designed; the location is excellent, near the top attractions and the tramline, and Galata Bridge. The Wellness Spa is luxurious, great for winding down if you're "mosqued out". Best of all are the helpful and friendly staff, who make an effort to talk to you as an individual - possible in a smallish hotel like this. A great hotel in every way!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel with atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: annelien1001sjaals
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and had very comfortable rooms. Spacious and full of luxury things (coffee/tea/shower). The rooms are well decorated with paintings of the sultan's women. Very original and beautiful. Exactly as in the pictures on their website! The breakfast was very good including free fresh orange juice! They also have a lady in the house who can tell you all nice spots in Istanbul. From this hotel you can walk the old city and go to taksim by taxi. Next time I will stay here again. This is the best hotel I ever stayed in in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ralphine1
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed four days at this hotel. It was without fault. It is in a perfect position, walking distance to all main attractions in Sultanahmet and beyond. Rooms are spacious and full of atmosphere. They have all the amenities you could want. What makes it special though is the staff. From the minute you arrive you feel that they are genuinely concerned about making your stay at the hotel and in Istanbul unforgettable. Our porter, Arafa, had such great passion and pride for the hotel. Everyday he was there to great us with a smile, keen to hear what we had seen and done and did whatever he could to help. The same with Huseyin in the cafe/bar. Within a day he seemed to know exactly what we would want after a day in the city. It was like staying with friends. Cannot recommend it highly enough

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in great location with very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hbmeri
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 7 days. It was very comfortable, clean and quiet. The rooms have everything you would need for your stay and the decor and lighting is fantastic. The staff are very helpful and attentive. The breakfast buffet is the best part of the stay with many choices to cater for everyone. A couple of tips: If you are like us and like to have a pre-dinner drink in your room, make sure you take some duty free with you because a bottle of very average white wine at the supermarket was nearly 17 lire. Nearest Supermarket: Leave the hotel lobby and turn right, turn right again at the end of the small street outside and then turn left. Walk about 50 metres to the end of that street and you will see a main street with the tram line and tram stop in front of you. Turn right and walk up the hill beside the tram lines until you get to a fork in the road. The road with the tram lines veers left and the other one goes up the hill. Take the one on the right and go up hill for about 500 metres until you get the first main road. There is a hotel on the corner called the Arden City Hotel. Turn right at the hotel and cross to the other side of the road so you are walking on the left side of the road. Keep going for about 100 metres to the next street left. There is a blue sign that points to the Grand Bazarre. Opposite that sign and just about where you are standing you will see Greens Supermarket down stairs. It's only about a ten minute walk from the hotel. Scammers: We got caught by an old trick and chances are it will be tried on you. The scam involves the shoe shine guys that work in the area and goes like this. You are walking along minding your own business and if you are alert you will notice a man with a shoe shine kit walk in front of you. If you are not alert the first thing you will see will be a brush drop in front of you. Because you're nice people and it's your first reaction to help you will call out to him that he has dropped one of his brushes and probably pick it up for him. He thanks you profusely and insists on giving you a shoe polish. He takes quite a long time and at the same time starts spinning you a yarn about his sick daughter/son in hospital etc etc. At the end he will be there with his hand out. We gave him a few coins and he then insisted we give him "paper money". I was going to give him a 5 lire note to get rid of him but only had a 20. He said he had change and then tried to say that he charged 25 lire for a clean. We were very angry by this time and said no way, so he passed over a note which turned out to be a 5. So we got fleeced 15 lire for a clean which should have only cost 1 or 2. To add insult to injury the same guy tried it on us again a few days later. We took great pleasure in just standing there and staring at him. I said "nice try!!". He just smiled, picked up the brush and ambled off. So Watch Out!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: denverxt
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 night stay at Sultania Hotel in Istanbul. Its location is excellent, very rich & tasty breakfast, excellent service, nice decor, very good facilities. I highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: MrsHasmat
Reviews.Content: The hotel was superb! It's close to the main attractions in Sultanahmet and Sikerci area. Very, very clean and beautiful room, awsome bathroom, and marvelous and helpful staff! Ramazan and Ozlem are the gems of the hotel. They were ever so willing to help us and they recommended the best tours during our 3-night stay there! We took the honeymoon package, and it was worth every single cents. Their breakfast was also up to the standard. The personal touch really made the difference.. We would certainly stay in this hotel again if we visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Turkishvisitor
Reviews.Content: I'm not generally enthusiastic about hotels but the Sultania is a great Hotel. My wife and I stayed for 3 nights last week in January and it was excellent. Everything was good, the welcome, the room, good sized, bright and airy with everything you need, breakfast, what a choice. However, it was the staff that really made a difference, they were all wonderful, friendly, interested and always willing to talk and help us with the little Turkish we know. We ate in the Bistro and in the Olive restaurant and the meals were excellent, the fajitas and the Sultan Kebap I can recommend. We have been to Istanbul twice now and have seen a lot of the city but we'd go back there just to stay at the Sultania,

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel - wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: PrinceWalter
Reviews.Content: You can't go past this exquisite hotel located in a very central part of Istanbul, close to many of the city's main attractions and just a brisk 10 minute walk from the Grand Bazaar. Service was fantastic and for once, the room you stay in actually looks EXACTLY like the one on the hotel's website. Affordable luxury - wish i was still there! And the food in their lovely dining room is gorgeous. Superb accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: Family-Shahali
Reviews.Content: We were in November of 2010 for few of days the guest of Hotel Sultania. It is a very clean, charming hotel with very friendly staff and within walking distance of many interesting and Historical locations of Istanbul. It is located in a quiet side street. We have enjoyed our stay in Istanbul. If we ever go back to Istanbul, for sure Sultania will be again our choice to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel at a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: lican7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Sultania in December for three days during a stopover with the intention to get to know the main sights of Istanbul. Sultania was an excellent choice, being at a walking distance from Hagia Sofia, Topkapi and the Blue Mosque. The room was clean and comfortable and the people very kind and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “You can't ask more !!”
Reviews.Author: icrl
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Very friendly staff. Nice & new room. Great breakfast. I stayed 3 days at this hotel in Dec. 2010. It was a great memory. This hotel is not 5 star big hotel. However, it has its own charm that we can not find easily at huge chain hotels. Everything was perfect. All the people I met at or near this hotel area are good and friendly. If I go there next time, I definitely stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay in Instanbul”
Reviews.Author: alcromer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got returned from a wonderful trip to Istanbul. As always I used Trip Advisor to help me find the best hotel and I was not disappointed. Hotel Sultania is a beautiful boutique hotel (only 8 months old) in the old part of Istanbul, walking distance to all the top attractions and only a 2 minute walk to the tram. The rooms were simple, clean and modern (our room had small terrace on the 5th floor). The lobby was very modern and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was excellent (usually don't like them). The staff (especially Ozlem, Ramazan and Erdem) went above and beyond to make our stay almost perfect. Now only if they could do something about the rain. We are going back to Istanbul in May and look forward to staying at the Hotel Sultania again. Cheers

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jess78Paphos_Cyprus
Reviews.Content: I would like to say how fantastic our room was in this hotel, we stayed on the 5th floor with a balcony, and the room was beautfiully decorated, comfortable and well equipped. All the staff in the hotel were friendly and especially the lady on Guest Relations. The staff recommended places to visit and nice restaurants, all of which we were delighted with. The breakfast was plentiful and all very very nice. We ate in their Olive Restaurant and had a fantastic meal. I used their Spa and experienced the Bali Massage and Turkish Hammam which was a lovely treat. I could not fault this hotel in anyway, it was in a fanastic location, just a short walk from all the main sites, and a two minute walk away from the tram line, and only a 25 minute drive away from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent staff, great location!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sotiris_Ath_GR
Reviews.Content: It is actually one of the best hotels I ve stayed! Apart from the cleaniness of the rooms the great breakfast , the most impessing thing was the staff! The reception staff -all of them were so kind and helpful. The lady at the customers service at the reception extremely helpful and very sweet, always smiling and always willing to help! The lady at the spa was also very helpful and sweet! And last but not least the young doorman was so helpful, always helped us find a taxi and explained to the driver all the details of our destination! Over all a great great experience staying with them! I d also recommend the roof restaurant with good food and nice views of the city! The staff there was also very helpfull and very effective!

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable hotel, introducing you the spirit of Anatolia”
Reviews.Author: tsismetz
Reviews.Content: From the very first moment we entered the lobby all the stuff were very friendly, especially Ozlem Kaya in guests relations and Ramazan in reception. The room puts you right away in the atmosphere of the city with its exceptionnal decoration. Very nice spot in the middle of the old city, great restaurant in the roof garden with delicious traditional dishes and wonderful view of Ag. Sofia (especially at night). One of my best travel exeiriences.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: ThanosRubis
Reviews.Content: From the moment we enter the lobby hotel the man at the reception named Ramazan was very kind and helpfull. The hotel was very beautiful and clean and its amenities were more than enough.The rooms were nice decorated and made us feel like we were Sultans.The fitness room was perfect,the Haman area must be a little bigger because it was too crowded, the water of the pool wasn't very hot, and you had to purcase for a swimming cup in order to swim.The breakfast was good but it could improved.The internet connection at the business center was sometimes slow, and the wi-fi wasn't compatible with the greek devices ( I tried two greek smartphones) we parked the car at the hotel parking and we felt that was secure enough although it wasn't an uderground parking. The location of the hotel was perfect. Finally, Ozlem Kaya the Guest Relation officer was very helpfull, kind and giving very important and correct information.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful and ditinguish room i've ever seen!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hudaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a TOP location, you will be only few steps away from all the attractions that you must see in Istanbul. The Stuff are really nice and friendly specialy ""Ozlem"" she is a super nice lady and very helpful. I always pick big or 5 stars hotel, but this one was much better than any other hotel ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, clean modern room, fabulous food with a view!”
Reviews.Author: MattandZara
Reviews.Content: I should have written this some time ago so apologies to the Sultania for not doing so. The Hotel Sultania is tucked away in a beautiful (and quiet) part of the Sultanamet close to everything you would want to visit. The service was impeccable and what impressed me most was how clean, modern and spacious the rooms were. The hotel has the 'Olive' restaurant on top (with a roof terrace bar overlooking the Agia Sophia) which provides fantastic food and amazing views. It was full of Turkish groups and couples which is always a good sign. Amazing value for money and would say it's well above its star rating in comparison to other of the so called top end hotels we've stayed at in our time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !!!”
Reviews.Author: VLSK
Reviews.Content: Just a perfect hotel ! Nice rooms, helpfull and very friendly staf !!! Very good food, also upstairs in "Olive", spectacular view, very good service !!!

Reviews.Title: “a real treat!”
Reviews.Author: Nel1234
Reviews.Content: sultania is a great hotel for a romantic weekend away. funky rooms - everything has led 'back-lighting' / mood-lighting. facilities include free wifi, as well as pool (but buy / wear a swim-hat at reception). exceptionally friendly / helpful staff. good location (nearish grand bazaar, main mosques, etc). be warned: so comfortable / luxurious you may not venture outside much! oh, but somewhat 'thin' doors / windows mean noise can cause problems.

Reviews.Title: “Sultania Has It All”
Reviews.Author: itsthelatest
