Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel.... It was close to everything. Whether you are walking to all of the sites in the old city, or need to jump on a tram, it is in the ideal location. The breakfast is awesome, the staff is EXCEPTIONAL, and we will stay there again on our next trip. Now, what you may or may not like.... the matress is hard. Since there is no smoking in any restaurant, people smoke outside.... so if you open your window at night... all the smoke from outside finds its way up and in.... that is my only negative..... You must go to one of the old Hammams. This was in the top 10 experiences of my life! If you like to shop.... you will need a day in the old bazaar. Do not buy anything your first day. I waited till my 3rd day to find the best quality and the best prices. Do not worry that it is very high pressure.... I had my husband trail along and in Turkish say " no money"....by my 3rd visit, we got fabulous things at great prices.... much less than I would have paid if it was my first day. Do not miss the Harem section of Topaki Palace. This is a must. If the market is too overwhelming, start with the Spice Bazaar. If haggling is not for you.... the prices in the stores are the same as the best prices at the market. Just you will not find the selection. Alcohol is heavily taxed! Buy at the airport... drinks are more expensive then the most expensive restaurants in NYC...

Reviews.Title: “In Sultania Hotel you will not find all what you need but MORE !.”
Reviews.Author: decentman71
Reviews.Content: Before I decide to make my booking via the hotel website I have seen too many reviews here saying that this hotel is really over rated , sometimes when you see something which seem to be TOO MUCH , you have some concerns , when I went there , I just discovered that all the positive reviews I have read were true and this hotel deserves to be over rated as in simple phrase ( Everything there is just perfect ) !.

Reviews.Title: “I only this eat at the hotels resturant 3 times.”
Reviews.Author: titravel
Reviews.Content: Sultania Restaurant was excellent. Huyseyin and staff are top notch!!! If I come back a must stop and possibly stay at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mohamed074
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautifully done. Very romantic. There a beautiful details which make the difference .. The staff are very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sacrifice
Reviews.Content: Without trying to contradict a review: excellent room, excellent location, excellent staff. However, in November where the weather is not yet cold the hotel shares central heating with three other adjoining hotels. The room thermometer was saying 30 degrees Celsius and you wake three or four times a night in a liquid sweat. Utterly uncomfortable. Any other time of the year you would think you found the small hotel of your life. great breakfast, brilliant staff, small but lovely rooms... but the heat. Why? Annoying that the staff known but are happy to let you baste. When you complain, they send up the porter who speaks limited English. Hey as a business man, I'd do the same...but it's a repeating problem obviously that should be solved.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time and worm people”
Reviews.Author: mehti
Reviews.Content: It was very immpressive and me and my family got really leisure over there. We came from Baku and as we are actually themselves hospitality people of course this moment was very important for us. And our expectations got true. Staff were very friendly, positive, good-manner, easy-going. Any request had been tried to have done. Especially a lot of thanks to manager dealing to guests Mrs. Ozlem. If i have a chance again come to Istanbul I will stay there again. I will advise this hotel all of my friends, relatives and other persons who are going to this charming sity. Mehti

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and best place situated”
Reviews.Author: albelinchon
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a wonderful stay at the Sultania. ItÂ´s 10 min walking from everywhere (Great Bazaar, Santa Sofia, Blue Mosque, Bosphoro) The hotel is quiet and the staff very kind. It depicts the hospitality of the Turkish people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to Start your voyage through Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: alexantoniou
Reviews.Content: There isn't enough i could say about the service, location, the cleanliness, the hospitality food and overall chic of this Hotel. I would definitely go back. 5 stars and more!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for romantic vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Pashaslon
Reviews.Content: Ok. I stayed in the Sultan Deluxe room. Very unusual room with big comfortable bed. There are many red lights, a mirror on the ceiling. Everything is perfect. Maybe it's not cheap for Turkey, but I liked it very much. If you want to have good time with your spouse, then do it in this hotel. Just one thing. It's better to have a map, because it's not easy to go amiss.

Reviews.Title: “Feel like a sultan”
Reviews.Author: Junglejane24
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel in the centre of the old city. Very friendly staff with the best breakfast ever!!! The rooms are beautiful and our little 3 year old loved the sofa bed. Excellent value especially if you deal directly with the hotel and pay in cash for a further discount. Extremely popular hotel, definitely will stay there if we go back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bobbim55
Reviews.Content: Very friendly helpful staff and spacious, clean and well presented rooms. Unfortunately the room temperature cannot be individually controlled, so rooms are very warm at night. Restaurant has great menu and staff have good english and are very helpful and fun - particularly HÃ¹seyn!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great staff and service”
Reviews.Author: BANDLSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sultania for three nights during a month-long trip round Europe, and were delighted with our choice. The hotel is very clean and quiet with great rooms - for a brand new hotel it has heaps of character and funky design features. It is in a perfect location to explore all the main attractions in Sultanahmet, with great restaurants on the doorstep if you don't want to go far after a long day exploring. The staff were all fabulous - friendly, helpful and genuinely welcoming. We would highly recommend it to anyone staying in Istanbul, and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at Sultania”
Reviews.Author: RobgLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel Sultania was very comfortable and well equipped, perfect for our short break in Istanbul. The room was nicely decorated and lit and had modern touches such as an ipod dock and a tv hidden within the mirror. The bathroom was tastefully marble clad with a power shower. The breakfast was good with the highlight being the honey, fresh from a local village, still in the comb, sat pride of place on the bar. Fresh pancakes were also good with a rose petal jam. Those looking for home comforts might be disappointed with the tea and coffee though. Service was excellent, with all staff being extremely helpful. Guest relations were exceptionally friendly and genuinely cared about helping us make the most of our stay. Ozlem is a real asset to the team. I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be staying there next time I am in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic romantic place”
Reviews.Author: groovy_j
Reviews.Content: Sultania is a brilliant place for a romantic getaway. In the heart of Istanbul's old town, many of the top sights are within walking distance. At the same time, the hotel is very quiet because it is in a side street (in contrast to many high-street hotels in the area!) Hotel staff are very friendly, value for money is very good - we were actually upgraded to the honeymoon suite at no extra cost!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic ... if they remember to pick you up”
Reviews.Author: ajtraveller007
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel, only open a few months and I would highly recommend it. My only complaint is that they were suppose to pick us up at the airport and didn't. I overheard another couple at reception with the same complaint so this is something that needs to be ironed out. It was not appreciated after 22 hours of traveling. However, that is my only complaint and I would most definitely stay at the hotel again. The rooms are beautiful and have every convenience including ipod docks, flat screens tvs (hidden behind a mirror) with some english channels, irons, safe with plug inside so you can charge your laptop, facilities to make your own coffee and free wifi. The bathroom was huge with lots of shelf room. We were in a room with a balcony and it was great. Very large and very quiet. The breakfast buffet was excellent with even a large piece of honeycomb. The restaurant upstairs served delicious turkish food with the spectacular Hagia Sophia lit up as the view. The location was very central with all the major sites within walking distance. Even the ferry is not that far away. I have to mention Ozlem Kaya who is the guest relations officer. She is an absolute jewel, there to give you advice about your day and thrilled to be able to teach your turkish if you want. We had one problem with our key for the room and it was dealt with quickly and with every consideration for our comfort. The chambermaid dragged over an ottoman so that we wouldn't have to stand while we waited for the technician. Now that is service. So despite a rocky start I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else the next time I travel to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MsDaisy2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 nights end of august/beginning of september and I loved the following: 1. Service: Excellent service at all times. Especially by Guest Relations manager Ozlem Kaya, for whom nothing was too much trouble. She accompanied us to the local clinic to translate when my friend needed to be given an injection. Random acts of thoughtfulness throughout our stay by her and other members of reception staff such as Erdem. 2. Lovely clean rooms: just the right amount of space. Everything is brand new and works impeccably. complimentary tea, coffee, and small cups of still water refreshed daily. 3. 3. Quiet at night: Considering the buzzing location, the excellent soundproofing means you don't hear a thing in the rooms. Rooms were always impeccably clean when we got back after a long day out. 4. Location: pedestrian street off the main road. Minutes away from major sights. Lots of cafes and restaurants around. 5. The olive restaurant in the adjoining Yasmin Hotel (part of the hotel group) is excellent with a lovely roof terrace. The vine leaves I had there are the best i had in Istanbul and that's one of my favourite dishes so I tried it everywhere. The staff both in the restaurant as well as in the breakfast room are very courteous and professional. I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Every detail of the Hotel was wonderful - I felt taken back in time to the era of the sultans.”
Reviews.Author: lonetraveler80
Reviews.Content: I can not give enough praise to the staff of the Hotel Sultania or to the luxury and comfort of the hotel. I was immediately greeted and made to feel very welcome. The very knowledgeable bellman who showed me to my room explained some of the details of the hotel and of my room. The ceilings in the hall were arched and ornate and reminded me of those that I had seen in the Topkapi Palace. As a novelty each room is named after a woman in the Harem instead of numbered. A paining of her hangs over the bed and a history of that particular woman is in a scroll that is given as a gift. The mood of Old Istanbul was completed with lovely paintings on the glass walls of the bath and a velvet cushion of Turkish Delight left on the bed. The entire hotel is beautifully appointed including delightful views from the roof where tea and coffee are served. I had lunch in the main restaurant and enjoyed a complimentary full breakfast - both were fresh and delicious. It is also a bonus that this hotel is located in the heart of Old Istanbul I had come from a stay at a highly rated hotel in the new city but I loved this hotel and when (not if) I return to Istanbul I would stay at no other place than Hotel Sultania.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel in an excellent location and a First Class staff.”
Reviews.Author: DaveHM8503
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be in the heart of the city for our 3 day visit and Hotel Sultania fit the bill. Located on a street closed off to vehicle traffic. Within walking distance of the Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, and the Grand Bazaar. A great buffet breakfast and wonderful food at the Olive restaraunt. However, the one thing that made this hotel "stand out" was the excellent front desk staff that guided us to excellent restaurants (made reservations) and valuable recommendations on places to go and things to do.

Reviews.Title: “First time, right choice”
Reviews.Author: dave_reeder
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Istanbul and I chose a great hotel to experience it. Very comfortable, very welcoming staff, nice touches everywhere, such a complimentary slices of Turkish Delight in a copper bowl to welcome you to the room. Rooftop restaurant Olive has stunning views of Aya Sophia - over the trees to the floodlight dome. One confusing element - Olive is shared by four hotels run by the same owners. Why not just make it a single hotel complex? Finally, it couldn't be closer to the key sites - five minutes or so up the hill to Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosque, the same down to the Bosphorus and the cruise boats.

Reviews.Title: “superbly pleasant”
Reviews.Author: alostil
Reviews.Content: superbly located in touristic Istanbul, friendly staff and (smiling Ozlem). Hotel clean, neat and very well serviced. very good restaurant on the top floor. room was spacious and superbly decorated with all needed amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful personnel”
Reviews.Author: daniela065
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern hotel with ambiance. Very friendly personnel.

Reviews.Title: “A PERFECT LITTLE BOUTIQUE HOTEL IN ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: JEAN S
Reviews.Content: We hesitated to give our advice on the Sultania, for fear that too big a popularity would spoil this excellent hotel . We had selected the Sultania after having read the very positive comments on Trip Advisor and have in no way been disapointed . This boutique hotel, ideally situated in the old town, close to the major sightseeing places, is a little gem . You statrt with a most friendly and professional welcome . The rooms, tastefully decorated in Ottoman syle are large enough, many of them with a balcony overlooking the Bosphorus . The marble tiled bathrooms are worthy of a 5 star palace . Although there are more affordable hotels around, this one will give you excellent value for money and you will leave it with regrets, promising yourself you will come back ( Istanbul is a magic place you can visit a dozen times without getting bored ) . The service again is simply perfect with attentions that make you feel more like a friend than a guest ( do you know many hotels who send you a mail after you left to make sure you had a safe trip ? ) - with a special mention for Ms Ã–zlem Kaya, Guest Relation Mgr . Any "negative" comment ? Well, the Sultania seems to become very popular for Gulf visitors and somtimes the lobby looks a little bit "veiled" - but this adds some "Topkapi's harem" touch ... We just hope the Sultania will be as pleasant when we come back !

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Lux Hotel for a family stay.”
Reviews.Author: Marmari2010
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in perfect location, Not noisy, near all tourist sites, metro station, restaurants, bars, shisha (nargile) chill out places and quaity suvanier shops. New & modern, but not pastic, nicely furnished with character, well fitted out with TV, audio equipment, LAN connection. However, most of all the staff are the nicest of any hotel I have stayed. If you are offered to stay in this hotel do not even hesitate. I will definately go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: me550
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very clean and modern decor. The staff are very kind and have alot of pride in the place. Room was lovely, I especially liked the underlit bed! I would definitely use this hotel again when I am in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly perfect for the price”
Reviews.Author: fastyak
Reviews.Content: We planed our trip to Istanbul for one week of holidays and were looking for a nice and superior hotel in a good location. Since Sultania is a pretty new hotel we thought it would be worth trying it. Our arrival at the hotel was good, nothing to complain about. Although we didnt take the hotel shuttle with a price of 100â‚¬ one way from the airport, a total rip off!!! You get private shuttels for 50â‚¬ all over the place. Checkin was fast and without any problems. We had booked a room with a balcony which was on the fifth floor, a relativly large room, but since under the roof, a very low ceiling. The balcony had no view and was pretty dirty, old dishes on a table and waste on the floor, which, didnt change for the whole stay of 8 nights. The interior is some kind of neo-ottoman wanna be luxurious style, a bit kitsch but good in function. The flatscreen TV behind a mirror is a nice gimic although way too small for the relatively far distance to the bed. The bathroom all in marble was pretty ok, the hairdryer overheating all the time and quite annoying. The breakfast was for the price of the hotel not exactly perfect. Yes you have some fruits, fresh orangejuice and the honey is pretty good but all in all nothing special. I ve been staying an a whole bunch of four and fife star hotels in my life so I know what you can get for your money. So as a resumee, its a good hotel, no doubt, but not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Sunset71
Reviews.Content: I originally stayed at Yasmak Sultan Hotel but one night was transferred to Sultania. This is a brand new hotel, my experience was short there; however, I can say that what impressed me the most was the stylish room beautifully decorated at the Ottoman style without missing the modernity to enjoy of a pleasant stay. Lights around beds, LCD TV, music, portraits with explanations of Ottoman Sultans' wives and a comfortable bathroom with delicate toiletries create a very special environment into the rooms. I think every detail included and ithe elegance and beauty make this hotel a very good option to stay in the Sultanhamet area for those who enjoy luxury very much. Like the other hotels of the group it offers restaurant at the ground floor but it is also possible to go to the restaurant at the roof terrace. There is a complimentary tea-coffee service in the room as well. All in all, a very modern an elegant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but more style than substance”
Reviews.Author: Junaid018
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during our honeymoon. Firstly, the location is perfect, within walking distance of the major attractions in Sultanahmet (main tourist area). No need for a taxi, or even the tram. There is ample oppurtunity for sight-seeing, restaurants and shopping. The hotel is very new, and thus clean and tidy. The staff were very friendly. The room we stayed in was spacious. The room looked great, and very fashionable. However, it is more style than quality. The breakfast at the hotel was excellent, with an array of food to choose from, and fresh tea served by the attentive waiters. The hotel also has a roof-top restaurant, but we did not have time to try it. Overall, this was a very nice hotel, in the ideal location (albeit a bit pricey).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: rk-winelover17
Reviews.Content: We randomly found this hotel during our trip planning and so glad we did. This hotel is in a perfect location for sightseeing in the Old Town. It is also a new hotel, and so the decor, appliances, etc are all new and feels modern. We were a little dissapointed that our room didn't really look like what was on their website, but overall pleased with everything. The hotel is very clean, serves a nice breakfast, has friendly staff, and we felt very welcome here. I would def. recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great deal”
Reviews.Author: wagnerers
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room at the Yasmak Sultan Hotel for two nights, but were upgraded to their sister Hotel the Sultania. The room was wonderful, and very large for Europe. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was amazing. The breakfast buffet was great. We arrived late at night and were shown to our room by a very attentive staff member who showed us everything from how to use the safe and hair dryer to the pictures on the walls. The pool, fitness centre and spa were not yet open. This was the nicest hotel all round that we stayed in on our 3 1/2 week long trip. We found a great deal through a canadian website (expedia.ca) and paid just under $100 canadian (which is just over $90 US). I would say that even double that price is worth it for the hotel. We stayed in Istanbul prior to this very close to the Hippodrome and that hotel was a little closer to the major sites like the Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, the Palace and a lot of restaurants, however I got a lot of dirty looks in that neighbourhood alone and we found the Sultania to be in a better neighbourhood for tourists who aren't willing to wear long sleeves and skirts in the July heat.

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate place to take a baby!”
Reviews.Author: MARYBRACKEN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel Sultania for six nights. We are a couple with a six month old baby. The hotel itself is beautiful. Our room was spacious and relaxing with lovely lighting, decorated very nicely. Daily room service excellent, replacing things as we needed. Lovely TV, DVD and mini bar. The lobby and breakfast room are great, cool designs. The breakfast on offer each day is fresh, varied and tasty. Wonderful coffee and fresh fruits. There was also omlet made to order if you like and other cooked options. Fantastic fresh breads and pastries too. Traditional Turkish breakfast also. But the best part of our break was the wonderful service delivered by sublime staff. I can mention Ozlem and Arafa in particular but each staff member at every level was genuine, caring and lovely. Also the bar man in the evening and during the day was great. Our baby daughter absolutely loved this hotel and was given so much attention and love by the staff, who remembered her name and played with her with real affection every day. I highly recommend this hotel to anybody but especially to a family. The swimming pool and Turkish bath were not open during our stay but these facilities can only add to a fantastic place. The roof top bar is gorgeous and I recommend the Turkish coffee, presented beautifully. If you are reading this and trying to make a decision about a hotel, book this one, you wont regret it! These people have put a huge amount of effort and thought into this hotel and it deserves to be number 1 hotel in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Staff”
Reviews.Author: AbouNaji
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and is very comfortable but what is most amazing about it is the hospitality and quality of service you receive from the staff. I have stayed in hotels all over the world but have never been in a hotel where my family and I received such attention and outstanding service from hotel staff as in Hotel Sultania. We stayed at this hotel for ten nights and we really felt we were treated like family. My wife had an upset stomach and needed to be seen by a doctor so one of the staff members at Hotel Sultania went with us to the hospital and translated from English to Turkish and took us around the hospital to where we needed to go. She was a real blessing, without her I don't know how we would have managed to get around the hospital and communicate with the medical staff there. I was very impressed as well by the fact that the hotel management was willing to allow one of their staff members to spend her whole day with us in the hospital. This alone tells you how much this hotel values their customers. When my wife returned from the hospital to the hotel she was treated like royalty by the hotel staff and management. The hotel kitchen prepared special meals for her (rice and boiled potatoes) at no charge for three days until she got better. The hotel even had the food delivered to her room and again at no charge. Constantly the hotel staff would ask me how she was doing and if she needed anything in particular that they could cook for her. My wife recovered and we were able to enjoy the rest of our family vacation in Istanbul. The hotel staff were also very nice and showed a lot of caring towards our 15 month old son who was with us. If you are traveling with children you can be very confident this hotel is family friendly. When we left the hotel it really felt like we were leaving family behind. When we go to Istanbul again the only hotel I would stay at is Hotel Sultania.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: momo1984
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. It's located in Sultanahmet old city area, next to a tram station , two steps away from Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and the Grand Bazaar. The room we got was a delux sweet, very stylish, spacious and clean. The staff is really friendly and helpful. Although it was in a busy area it is a quiet hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place”
Reviews.Author: bulldogtwo
Reviews.Content: I was so lucky, happy, to have found this place on the web. It is a small boutique hotel that is located within walking distance to the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque and Spice Bazaars. This is not the best hotel that I have stayed in, and initially I was a little disappointed as it looks nothing like the pictures on the web, not that they ever are! But the staff here a five star. Were it not for the outstanding service, their sincere warmth and great attitude, it would be just another hotel. The staff are what makes this place worth every penny, from the reception to the bellman. The rooms are comfortable, good size, not big but comfortable and cozy. The beds are extremely comfortable and the showers were great with just the right amount of water pressure with two different heads to choose from. Restuarants everywhere but stay at the hotel, they're roof top restuarant is great! I had the smoked salmon starter and it was so big that it was plenty for me for dinner that I had to cancel my salad. Really nice breakfast buffet in the morning and you can have it either in the restuarant or on the sidewalk while enjoying the people walking by and the weather. Good coffee which was really important. The only thing I wanted which was not ready was the sauna and gym which was still under construction. Overall this is a great place to stay, and when you compare the other hotels at the same rate, this is a real deal!
